This wouldn't have been quite so bad, except I'd purchased this camera the day before a big media event especially to photgraph the town VIPs -- ended up having to borrow an old camera from one of our communications folks to complete the shoot.  Extremely disappointing!  Fortunately, I'd bought the P100 from a local photography specialty store who immediately accepted the return.  I still need a camera, but will never EVER buy another Nikon compact.

Reviews.Title: This is one HOT point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: William Schlake

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2TFHBKHTB53BGcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2TFHBKHTB53BGcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:37 MinsIn addition to the slideshow at left there's some indoor and outdoor shots under my profile and user photos that shows camera settings for several of the images. First, if you buy or are leaning in that direction, I implore you to READ THE MANUAL even if you don't normally read manuals. Its 200 pages and well written, packed with easy to understand how-to. If you skip doing that you might miss discovering many features you may not otherwise stumble on except by accident if ever.If you're in the market for a HD video camera this Nikon model might be all you need plus you get great digital photographs as a bonus. If you main interest is having a digital camera to take still photos, the P100 can produce high quality video in several modes: lower resolution HD at 1280x720, VGA 640x480 and QVGA 320x24 depending on speed settings plus full HD at 1920x1080. There's a neat little button/slider switch to set the camera to video mode. For the special effects (slower/faster speed) you need to set to HS, press the red button, wait for the REC confirmation on the LCD screen, then press the OK button to begin shooting at different speed otherwise you're just shooting at normal speed at lower resolution.The camera comes with software called ViewNX which makes it very easy to transfer both photos and videos to your computer for further processing. You can also do slideshows just with the camera or step through the images and videos. A nice notation feature allows you to make up to 20 second 'audio notes' for files that have a musical note sign (most formats do). You can play the vocal notes you recorded back while the file is still in the camera by just depressing one button or while in ViewNx. Don't like what you said, delete and try again. This feature carries over when you transfer files to a computer creating a .wav file with the same file name as the image.When using ViewNX I discovered by accident that JPEG files by default are compressed to about 80% of their shot compression value to save space when transferring to your computer. This can be easily changed so no extra compression happens which would reduce image quality, which I think is self-defeating. I suggest you make no additional compression your default option if you use ViewNX as your software of choice to transfer files to your computer. This software also shows a wealth of file information like date shot, modified, image quality, zoom, focal length, F/stop, etc., plus there's space to add personal notes like contact, description, key words, tags, a whole bunch of stuff that makes it handy. There's quite a few features in this better than average image viewer software. Be sure to check the built-in help for more features.OK, some of the nitty gritty... I won't cover everything, that would take forever, just some features I found interesting I didn't see others touch on in awhile.First, some reviewers suggest the photos aren'ts as sharp as other 10 MPX cameras. Well, yes and no. That's really subjective. Really depends on your settings. If you mainly want to print out 8X10 or smaller photos the sharpness is more than enough except for the real diehard purist crowd that thumb their noses at anything less than DSLR output. If the images are a bit soft for your tastes and you're sure it isn't because you're in one of the many override modes that alter auto settings (common error) you can sharpen and use more vivid settings which boosts contrast and adjust brightness and other things. Its well covered in the manual. Another reason I strongly suggest you read the entire manual, even if you do it in bits and pieces.Word of caution:If you have reasonable post production skills and know your way around Photoshop or similar image enhancement software for most images I wouldn't tweak with in-camera adjustments as to levels, contrast, you can do better (assuming you know how) using Photoshop, similar software. However sharpness and picking a vivid mode can make a noticeable difference as can ISO, and other settings.I really like how many choices you get to view images. You can click on a image in ViewNX, hold left mouse button down, changes to hand and you can zoom in to see details. Probably better is the Crop feature build into the camera electronics. Pick any image, give the W/T button a nudge all the way towards "T" and you now can zoom in on the photo using the left,right,up,down arrow keys. You'll be surprised how useful this is considering you can zoom in, effectively cropping the image and save that portion as a new file. Nice!Depending on what mode (look for a ?)you're in you can also access a simple help system that displays in the LCD monitor. Nice, while you're learning how to use the camera's many features. By the way, the P100 has a large three inch adjustable brightestness LCD monitor that pulls away from the camera and can be titled up and down making it easy to take those more difficult shots. It uses a beefy 640,000 pixel anti-glare screen. A simple switch lets you switch between this LCD monitor and a electronic view finder as your primary aiming device. A handy button allows to change what you see in the LCD. You can view most of the settings you selected on screen and also a usefule grid that divides the screen into nine sections, making it easy to follow one of photography's golden rules; "Rule of Thirds" If you're not familar with this, please LEARN, it can help you take more interesting pictures by properly framing the shot.If you have a HD TV that has HDMI input, get a HDMI to USB mini c cable. Not an absolute must, but the quality gets raised to the wow factor for slide shows and HD video playback because it stays digital all the way and there is no analog processing of the video or audio.A few other goodies that deserve mention. The sports continuous mode is GREAT if you're into sports, shooting your kids, etc.. It takes a series of stills in rapid sequence, you just push the shutter once and sit back. The result is slow to extra slow motion when played back depending on settings. Hint: if you're into video editing like I am and have decent software, this is a real boon in that you can really expand on this feature. Then there's subject tracking mode. You pick a "target" the camera "locks on" and keeps moving objects focused. Nice! Too many options to go into a detail here but I will say the various continous modes give crisp results even at very high shutter speeds.AF area mode is great for people that aren't that great taking pictures. It can automatically detect and focus on a face or a group of faces. Unlike some cameras that will only focus on the center of the frame you can manually focus anywhere in the frame in 99 steps. Has smile and blink detection too like many newer cameras do these days. Also worth noting are features that can take a series of pictures then the camera can select the best one, like when nobody blinked, or very nice for low light shots where in another mode five images are taken then automatically combined to capture the most highlights and details from shadows then combining into one "improved" picture. That's cool!There's much more to discover, why I'll repeat READ THE WHOLE MANUAL, you'll be glad you did.There are a few minor cons. The camera is too big to carry around in your pocket, a purse for the ladies, sure. It doesn't come with a case, again not a big deal. Two slightly annoying things are for this price range you'd think they would throw in a memory card, no, again, most companies don't either. The one real disapointment is it takes a good 3.5 hours to charge the battery. Worse to do it, the battery remains in the camera and you need to use the supplied USB cable. Amazon has extra batteries and a AC and even a car based charger. I got to get that. ;-) There's a silver lining is this USB feature. You can charge up you camera by simply plugging it in your USB port on your computer or laptop.A few things I wish the P100 had, but don't would be option to add your own flash attachment, though the build-in works fine for me so far. Also would be nice to have a option to plug in a cable shutter release. This comes in handy if you want tack sharp photos, just pushing the shutter down to fire the camera (any camera) can introduce a tad of vibration as any pro photographer will tell you, which is why a plug-in shutter release would be useful to insure razor sharp images, more so if you have heavy fingers pushing the trigger. The zoom feature only uses a slider scale to show how far you've zoomed in. OK, but no reading to let you know how far you've zoomed so each time is an adventure and a bit different. The battery indicator doesn't show how much battery strength is left. It doesn't show at all, until just before the battery is almost totally discharged. While minor, hope all these little annoyances will be addressed in future models. All in all the P100 is really a nice camera for beginner, serious hobbyist even pros that don't want to drag around some bulky DSLR and all its lens and attachements everywhere every day.

Reviews.Title: Bought it, used it for macro, returned it (poor quality pictures)!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Eugene L. Hirsch
Reviews.Content: Bought it for the Nikon name. Wanted it to replace early Panasonic Lumix "bridge" type camera. Read all about the camera. Reviews were positive and negative. I decided to try it for myself. I love to do macro photography of flowers and every day things. Many of the "reviewers" liked the camera over-all. However, quite a few said that the optics DO NOT create sharp macro photos. I used the camera for 3 days, took lots of pictures in my garden area of flowers and bugs. The pictures were not sharp!!!! I decided to return it and, instead, bought a Sony Cybershot HX-1. It's much better! I love the moveable 3" LCD and close-ups are great! If I were to buy a Nikon DSLR I think I would get better lens optics. But, I do not want to tug extra lenses around. That's about it.  Dr. Eugene L. Hirsch, Raleigh, NC

Reviews.Title: Good but FAR from great
Reviews.Author: G. Enfield
Reviews.Content: I played with buying this or the Canon SX20is. I purchased both - the vendor has a "no questions" 90 return policy - and decided to keep the Nikon because of the weight factor and the extra zoom. Then we went on a "one in a life time" vacation. I soon discovered: 1) the grid lines will only show in Program mode; 2) if you composed a shot of mountains with foothills in the foreground you see a BEAUTIFUL shot when the shutter is pressed halfway and then NO MOUNTAINS in the picture as they are washed out. You have to center the view on the sky behind the mountain, hold the shutter button half down to compose the shot and then complete the picture taking. Canon's averaging approach (with my pocket camera) produced fantastic shots with no difficulty. It is something needing to be learned but not expected in a camera costing this much.  I NEVER saw a low battery indicator. The camera would just quit without warning. Luckiy I had purchased a generic battery to carry as a backup. I tried taking pictures of the Alaska sunsets ... washed out on the "sunset" setting. Finally tried "night shot" and got decent sunsets at midnight. I suggest you wait until they upgrade the zoom and finder on the Canon and get a camera you can put filters on and that gives consistently good exposures at the settings you would expect.

Reviews.Title: Good, but took it back
Reviews.Author: C. Conrey "audio guy"
Reviews.Content: Feature wise the camera has everything you could want from a P&S; in a form factor that is better suited to my hands than the small flat Canon. Only had it a weak before returning it because of poor implementation:1) The zoom is WAY too fast with a non-functional "slow" mode. As a result it is impossible to crop to what you really want. If you are patient and shooting an inanimate object you might eventually get there but it is not suitable for moving subjects (kids). The Canon SX20 and Sony have MUCH smoother zoom control.2) This is a P&S; camera with DSLR type controls. With that in mind I was happy with the picture quality. However, one of the DSLR controls I was after was manual focus. Unfortunately, they way they implemented it is very clumsy and awkward (and again, not smooth control). If you don't need manual focus then this is not an issue.3) The final straw came when the auto focus locked up. I had taken a number of pictures w/out a problem so the light was ok. Once in this mode nothing I changed (zoom, flash, Auto mode) would fix it. I had to turn it off and take out the battery. It started working after that, but I need something first and foremost that is reliable.I really wanted this camera to work and really liked the way is fits in my hands - kind of a small version of my D40x. But I took it back and am looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: Below Expectation
Reviews.Author: A. Sutono, a.k.a., Birdey The Observer
Reviews.Content: Despite seemingly superior specifications in some respects to its peers, Nikon P100's image quality is somewhat dissapointing, particularly when the camera operates in one of the pre-defined settings to take outdoor photographs  Their pre-set modes; auto and portrait work OK for indoor objects, but the quality is poor when taking panoramic pictures. So most of the time, I have to manually adjust the shutter speed, ISO and aperture. But then it appears the minimum aperture of F8.0 is inadequate to produce a high-quality outdoor scenic photographs. When running in the manual mode, though I don't expect the step between two shutter speeds to be continuous, it is still too large for speeds greater than 1/100s. For example, between 1/400s to 1/1000s, there are only three intermediate options, 1/500, 1/640, and 1/800s. It is also a little cumbersome to change the ISO setting since you have to go to the menu.What is most annoying, however, is the software applications. I don't understand why there needs to be two separate applications; Nikon Transfer to transfer the photos to your PC and View NX to view and manage the photos. I have to admit, the details given in View NX is impressive where for each photo, it tells you the camera settings with which it was taken. But another annoying problem is that when the applications are running, they seem to take up a lot of memory and slow the system down. The data transfer between the camera and the PC is also slow. I thought it's USB2.0 running at least 12MBps and theoretically can be as fast as 480Mbps, but my observation is it is a lot less than 1Mbps. It might be because I'm running them on an old laptop, but it is hard to buy this argument since other applications including my old Kodak Easy Share runs much faster and doesn't slow the system down.So I have to say, while pricing-wise, P100 is affordable compared to other brands with the same or even greater optical zoom, but its performance doesn't live up to my expectations. Don't buy it if you don't enjoy playing with dials and knobs on the camera when trying to get an optimum configuration on the picture you're taking.

Reviews.Title: OK, but a little disappointed
Reviews.Author: B. Larson "Gadget Lover"
Reviews.Content: I really want to love this camera but I can't quite...First, the good stuff:Great pictures. I'm very happy with the photos and videos. Image stabalization and auto features work very well. Even zoomed all the way in I get great shots.Nice list of features and the 26x zoom is great - one of the main reasons I picked this camera.Mechanically it is a liitle too light-weight. I know it's not a full size DSLR but I was disappointed with the feel. It seems too small for my hand and just does not feel comfortable.Zoom is hard to control - kind of all or nothing.It has done a few wierd things where I have had to restart it.Worst of all, the zoom is starting to sound very noisy. I think I'm going to have to contact Nikon to see what that's all about.Not bad for the price, but I wish I would have spent more and gotten something a liitle more solid.I sent it to Nikon and they fixed the zoom (which had gotten worse) for free. After using it more I have come to like it a lot and feel more comfortable with it. Still, a bit lightwheight - I would hate to drop it - but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: A Very Good Point-and-Shoot Super-Zoom Camera
Reviews.Author: Walter B. Pavam
Reviews.Content: After 2 months and 1800 shots, IN MY OPINION there are several pros and some cons. My conclusion is that the camera is fine for an amateur - like me - interested in pictures that require extra optical zoom.Pros:Lens are superb, quality of pictures in general is above all previous Sony cameras I've been using (including Sony H10 with Carl Weiss lens);Zoom system is great, it is fast to zoom in or out, but it can be difficult to focus in extreme telephoto. If you don't have a tripod, try vibration reduction to "hybrid" position, it works well. I took beautiful pictures of The Moon with and without a tripod;Scene modes work well if you don't like to lose time setting things in a camera. Panorama Assist is gorgeous - you can easily shoot many beautiful panoramas. Stitch the pictures in the software that comes with the CD;HD movie has VERY good quality, but it requires a lot of battery and SD card space;White Balance works very well in most situations, you can let it in automatic setting, except under incandescent light (yellow light);Electronic viewfinder is great when shooting in sunny outdoors, you can see perfectly the scenario while saving battery life;Flash is very good and fast and works well if the subject is until 20 feet away from the camera. When using flash I set white balance to "Flash", it is better than to "Automatic".Cons:As sensor seems to be very responsive to light, shutter speed tends to be very fast and colors tend to be pale in sunny outdoors. It is better to set exposure compensation to positive side (+EV). It is better to work with color optimization: "vivid" is fine for most situations. When shooting people, I took better results setting optimization to "Normal" or "Soft";At night, the sensor tends to slow down shutter speed excessively, so it is better to set exposure compensation to negative side (- EV). Set noise reduction to "on", otherwise your sky will seem much more light grey than black;Menus are terrible, I can't believe someone can find easy to change settings with this camera. In general it is better to set things to automatic, but I prefer to set a low ISO value, it is better for picture quality;Battery life is mediocre, YOU NEED a spare one (maybe 2) if you intend to stay all day long shooting pictures and movies.

Reviews.Title: An excellent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: golf guy
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect cross over from the very simple point and shoots to a DSLR.  Image quality is very good, especially in macro.  Features take some learning but will let you do a heck of a lot for under $300.  (Actually, for just the price of a decent macro lens, this camera will do a pretty good job and give you a whole other camera in your bag!)Caution:  While a bargain at this price, this camera is NOT a DSLR and if you're interested in owning other lenses, shooting raw images, etc. you may be disappointed in the long run.  For the price, this camera is great to have around as an option to your DSLR but it will not perform to the same standards of most DSLR models.  If I had it to do all over again, I would have stepped up to the plate for a D90 but I still can and find uses for this camera in certain situations, it's that good.Before you buy, really examine your interests in photography and equipment needs carefully.  This camera is an excellent choice for those that want a fairly simple, high quality "point and shoot" camera experience.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying I am not very experienced with cameras...I have had a few point and shoot cameras, but I have never delved into all of the features that are offered on any of them.  I bought this camera after reading many great reviews, and I LOVE IT.  The picture quality is great, and it is very easy to use.  It has lots of options that are easy to figure out, and I have been able to do a lot of things with it already, without even opening the users manual.  The camera is obviously heavier than the P & S cameras, but it doesn't seem heavy to me.  The only thing I don't like, is that it has a flip out screen, which I haven't been able to understand the point of.  Maybe I need to read more on this, because it says you can flip it 180 degrees to take pictures of yourself, but I can't get it to flip in any direction that will let me see myself while taking a picture.  I'll keep working on this.  I would definitely recommend this camera overall!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera!
Reviews.Author: LBINJ
Reviews.Content: I haven't even had this camera a week yet but I can say already that I LOVE IT! I have taken pictures of my active preschoolers and haven't missed a second of the action! I have them jumping in mud puddles about 6" off the groud and you can easily see the water/mud from the puddle to the bottom of their boots. My old point and shoot would have never captured this image. Absolutely awesome.I also took it to a Crossfit (sport) competion. I used the sports mode and captured the most in depth sequence pictures. Again, a point and shoot would never capture this!I love the way this camera feels in your hand. Not heavy at all.I wouldn't hesitate to buy this camera if you want an upgrade from a point and shoot but aren't ready for a full dslr. It is super easy to navigate and use! Its super fast too!I also purchased the extended warranty offered thru Amazon for $70. Three year full coverage on drops, spills etc. With two little ones its money well spent!

Reviews.Title: No buyer's remorse...
Reviews.Author: W. Miller
Reviews.Content: Sure it's not SLR, but after 2000 fantastic pictures in a wide range of settings, it has served me well.  Had a few pictures blown up to 20x30" posters and really impressed myself.  Make sure to buy a class-6 memory card if you want to take video, class-4 cards won't cut it. Zoom is hair-trigger and sometimes it randomly sticks which can be maddening - although this hasn't been happening as of lately. Battery charges in camera connected to USB or power supply. It's lightweight. It's reasonably fast. It has awesome zoom and pretty good vibration controls to help you with said zoom. Lots of presets to play with if full-auto mode doesn't work for you. Also has manual mode. If it were to be crushed in a horrible accident I wouldn't hesitate to but another one.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P100
Reviews.Author: nsoenk
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our daughter who has been enjoying an a photography class in school.  It takes some great pictures and has good features and adjustability yet is easy to use.  We may borrow it for a better vacation camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Dr Phil
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the excellent ratings in Consumers Reports magazine and so far I have been happy with it. It has many more controls than my old camera so I am still learning all the features and what it will do.

Reviews.Title: Nikon p100
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: Got this camera a few days before Xmas and I have to say it has been a pleasure learning to use this camera. We took our Christmas greeting cards with the camera and everyone said they looked professionally done. I am looking forward to using this camera more in the future. Also, takes Amazing full moon photos on the digital zoom....when mounted on tripod. ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: Renee
Reviews.Author: Renee Barber
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon p100 for myself because I like to take pictures. I love it. It is light weight has all the features I want. The pictures are very clear. And it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: David A. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted something better to shoot in low light settings. I have a Canon Rebel XT and while I love it, I also wanted something that will allow me to shoot in low light settings like inside during conferences and workshops. I have had this about a week now. Not enough time to give a detailed report on it, but I can say that while it does take great photos in low light, it suffers the same problem of not being to capture movement very well in low light.Overall a very good camera, but if you are thinking this will do more than the other SLR digitala on the market.....maybe not.I did buy this from Amazon and I got a really good price. [...] and free shipping through Amazon Prime.UPDATE 3=29=2012Just to provide an update. This has proven to be a good camera. I have found that the auto focus doesn't work that well in low light conditions. If you use the pop up flash, it does send out an IR signal that serves to focus the shot but without the flash on, it is not as sharp on its focus.

Reviews.Title: This is a very good camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: M. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.It's not a DSLR and should not be compared to one. If you don't want to be bothered with carrying a big camera bag loaded with different lenses then you will like this camera. It handles a variety of shooting situations with ease and if you read the manual, and practice, you can take some excellent shots.I am happy with my purchase and have recommended this camera and Amazon to many of my friends.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera that produces remarkably good pictures. I have rather large hands, and the camera is very comfortable to hold; with conveniently positioned controls. Anyone using it, however, should keep the 200-page instruction manual nearby. It makes a big difference if you understand the many useful settings and features. About the only disappointing feature so far has been the microphones that pick up camera-handling noises, operator breathing, and lens zoom.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Superzoom
Reviews.Author: Lucky44
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera in my estimation, as long as you compare it to others in superzoom category.  I am very impressed with the image stabilization when zoomed out to the longest ranges.  That is a clear deficiency for many of these types of cameras, but I think Nikon has done a nice job in making the P100 useable even at 26X zoom.  I'm also impressed with the image quality of photos taken with flash.  Not something I expected at all from any point and shoot camera.  Other thoughts:  LCD provides a great view, though I wish it was truly articulating (like Canon) as opposed to just flipping up and down; good mix of manual controls on camera and easy to access and understand menus; the camera seems a bit cheap to me overall (lens kind of rattles), but it is not that bad; it would have been nice to have a battery charger included, but not a deal breaker.You do have to remember, with this or any superzoom, that you are limited by small sensor.  Camera is basically useless in low light without flash, and overall image quality will not compare to pricier, less zoomy point and shoots like Panasonic LX5 or Canon S95 or Canon G12 or Nikon P7000.  But for what you pay and presumably why you buy a superzoom -- the zoom -- the P100 is a nice value.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P100
Reviews.Author: avocet "avocet"
Reviews.Content: A lightweight, easy to use, camera which allows we inexperienced photographers some feel as to features available in more expensive equipment.  Stabilization when using zoom I find fantastic.  Would prefer a longer lifetime for the battery but don't have much of a basis to compare.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sheryl Lucas
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for taking pictures of wild life without getting too close( birds, wolves, alligators, bears, buffalos, etc). We are not professional photographers but this camera makes it seem as though we are.  The menues are intuitive and the results are striking.  It is a large, heavy camera ( though not as large, bulky as a SLR), nevertheless, my husband and I are taking it to Italy with us because we know that the pictures will be wonderful with no wasted opportunities.  We would certainly buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for beginners who wish to use DSLRs
Reviews.Author: Muthu
Reviews.Content: Hi,  I am a beginner when it comes to photography. I would like to have a try on this product before going in for a DSLR camera due to of course cost factor and usability.I have been using this product for almost a month now, and i would love to say that i am much happy with the performance of this camera, mainly for the kind of picture it takes in MACRO mode. There are lot many options that i need to test before sending in a detailed review, but so far most of the pictures i have taken using AUTO mode came well.I haven't got any complaints like others described on camera hanging off automatically.All i get is a warning when i switch on my camera, with LENS CAP on. I will switch if off, remove Lens Cap and will then switch it on.From what i have learnt so far , any pictures that you zoom in beyond 18X would get its expected quality only when you use a TRIPOD.Overall, I am much satisfied with the performance of my Nikon P100 and hope to use it for much more time before getting hands on DSLRs.Nikon P100 is really Worth for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Camera for the novice
Reviews.Author: harmonyp
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after owning a crappy, old Kodak easyshare point and shoot that my two year old broke. At first, the reviews were overwhelming. I do not want a D-SLR, as I know I am not a professional or a hobby photographer. I wanted something I could zoom and get candid shots of my daughter. I will admit the zoom is a bit cumbersome, the ergonomics could probably be improved, but part of that is just getting to know the device. To date I have been very pleased with this camera. It is easy to use, I like having a viewfinder and the quality of the photograph is vastly better than my old point and shoot. Honestly, we have a Flip video camera, so I have not used the video on this camera. My point is, if you aren't an avid photographer, this camera will likely suit you.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ashley Sommella
Reviews.Content: I find the camera to be great. it takes alomost excellent long distances shots and great pictures in general. It does take a little time to focus itself but i find that it is worth the time because the pictures come out so clear. great camera

Reviews.Title: Versatile point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: sticks
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for only a short time. Nonetheless I was able (because of my experience in photography) to judge the camera fairly. I was also able to determine the cause of some problems others have experienced.Several owners have registered complaints about the camera "locking" when they have zoomed out and needing to turn the camera off before it will retract. I suspect this is because the user was employing the digital zoom feature of the camera. I have experienced this same problem with the digital zoom in other point-and-shoot cameras including the Canon PowerShot SX20 (one of which I own also). Digital zoom is software, not hardware. Like other software it sometimes hits a "glitch" and might cause the hardware to malfunction, just as computer software sometimes does to the computer. Other digital point-and-shoot cameras with digital zoom have the feature as an option to be activated in the setup menu. The Nikon CoolPix P100 have the digital zoom feature on by default. It can be deactivated in the setup menu.Some owners have mentioned that the photos from this camera are "washed out". The Nikon CoolPix P100 does, indeed, tend to produce results lighter in color than the subject. There is an "Exposure Compensation" feature that enables the user to adjust to darken or lighten the exposure. It is accessed by pressing the right side of the Multi Selector and is adjusted by pressing "up" or "down" as needed. Unless you are using the "Auto" mode the setting you choose will remain after turning off the camera.The design of the lens cap leaves something to be desired. Rather than being on the lens it is snapped onto the camera body. This is the cause of "Lens Error" messages and potentially camera damage. When the camera is turned on the lens automatically extends about ¼ inch. If the lens cap has not been removed it is physically impossible for the lens to make this initial, automatic, extension. Hence the error message. Hence potential damage to the camera.The camera seems rather sensitive. My hand accidentally came in contact with the side of the lens when extended which resulted in an instant "lens error" message and instructions to remove the lens cap and turn the camera off and back on. However, I was able to take my photo with neither "corrective action" being taken.The barrel of the lens housing is tapered. This makes the camera somewhat difficult to hold when steadying it during macro shots or shots made in low light. All my other cameras (Canon ((including a DSLR)) and Fuji) have straight barrels.I have not tried the video feature of the camera nor will I. I prefer to use an actual video camera.I installed the portion of the software for downloading that came with the camera. It didn't work. This is not a problem for me because I prefer to remove the memory stick and read it with my card reader.I use all my cameras extensively. It remains to be seen if the Nikon CoolPix P100 becomes my point-and-shoot of choice.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Breakdown
Reviews.Author: Disappointed Dad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this camera due to the Nikon reputation, the many features, and the 26x zoom - to be used for an African safari to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. Neither of us are photographers or that knowledgeable when it comes to photography so we wanted a fairly easy-to-use camera.  The Coolpix 100 did not disappoint us!  I read the operating manual prior to the trip and got familiar with the camera's features, modes, and settings and we got many, hundreds, of fantastic photos. So the zoom and overall picture quality was very good.The downside, immediately upon use the camera would "lock" up - something I saw written in other reviews.  And to resolve, had to remove the battery and reinsert and boot up.  This happened during our first safari - a major problem when eying what should be a memorable shot.The second and more recent issue, after about a year's ownership, is that the screen image goes out and is replaced with a grainy, "negative film type" image - sorry but that's the best I can describe it.  At times it would go away and the normal image would re-appear after moving the screen around a bit, but now it seems locked in this awful image.  Alternative is to use the viewfinder which is not my preference.  Doubtful if it is worth sending to Nikon for repair as the camera is out of warranty, or simply look for a newer model with similar features that we enjoy.  Just not sure if it will be a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: ruggy35
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It has everything i was looking for. It takes beautiful pictures. I have not had any issues with it. Battery life is great. I ordered extra batteries as reserve but i have never found that i was constantly chaging the camera. I am not a professional photographer but this camera makes me feel like one. It has so many advanced features that a regular camera does not have. This is a wise choice for a good camera.

Reviews.Title: A Little Disappointed - 3.5 stars
Reviews.Author: DanC NJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a factory refurb for $159, so I shouldn't complain too much. I have an Olympus Pen E-PL1 that I am very pleased with, but I wanted a do-it-all camera with a lot of zoom. I like that it has a EVF, even though it's not very good, and the tilt LCD is a nice feature. I mostly bought this over some other models because of the back lit CMOS sensor. I was expecting better image quality, and I am relatively pleased. I believe most reviewers on here bashing this camera for image quality have unreasonable expectations. It is still a P&S; camera, not a DSLR.The indoor/poor lighting image quality is actually better than I expected. The 1080p video is nice, and the camera does an adequate job keeping focus, even though there is some lag when zooming in or out. The zoom works well, and it is possible to get good shots without a tripod when at full zoom, thanks to the VR. Manual controls are nice, and user friendly.My main problem with this camera is the quality of the build. Although it's a good size, and lightweight, it just feels cheap. The lens is sloppy, rattles when you shake the camera. Because of the play in the lens assembly, there is some sag when at full extension. Like others, I have experienced 2 lens errors, but have not had a hard lock up, and have not had to pull the battery. The lens error seems to happen after shooting video, then going back to shooting photos, it stops responding, then generates an error message, thinking the lens cap might be on.I just updated the firmware from V1.0 to V1.2, and I will edit this review later if this resolves the lens error problem. There is one fix in  the V1.1 update that sounds like it could resolve the issue. As far as the firmware update, that's a little disappointing also. You must have a SD card reader to move the file from your PC to the  SD Card, you cannot move it to the card via the camera. I was able to update the firmware for my Pen online, a much simpler process.Here is the firmware update fixes:[Version 1.2]"When the monitor was turned on by pressing the power switch or shutter-release button, or by rotating the mode dial, after the camera had entered standby mode with the auto off function with the Welcome screen set to any option other than None (default setting), monitor display was completely black with only information displayed.  Further, when the shutter-release button was pressed halfway with this monitor display, the view through the lens was displayed, but the display included a significant amount of noise."[Version 1.1]* Distortion control and Auto bracketing can now be enabled at the same time.* An issue that caused light sources to appear green with continuous shooting in Night landscape scene mode has been resolved.* When the camera was turned on by pressing the playback button with the mode dial set to "U" (user setting mode), and the MENU button then pressed, an error message was displayed.  This issue has been resolved.* An issue that prevented the zoom from operating when the zoom control was pressed in the "T" direction and then immediately pressed in the "W" direction has been resolved.* An issue that prevented the shutter speed display from blinking when the shutter speed specified with the mode dial set to "S" would result in under-exposure has been resolved.I have owned several cameras from different manufacturers, and this is the poorest build quality I've seen. This is my first, and probably last Nikon. For what I paid for it, and for what I need it for, it will do the job. If I were doing it again, I'd buy the Oly SP810UZ.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ravi
Reviews.Content: I own a Sony DSC too but this has better zoom than the other and cheaper too. I would recommend this product if you are not looking for a SLR but need a camera with a good zoom.

Reviews.Title: very good job from this product
Reviews.Author: C. BAUTISTA
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I got a "high end" camera, so many ppl may say: "Well this is not a high end camera, it is not even a SLR". However, for me was my first over a $200 camera and I really wanted something good, something that could make a difference in my next trip vacations pics, and definitely this product did it.I didn't want an SLR, first because you have to invest some time and maybe money in some training, and besides I didn't want to carry a extra heavy and fragile back pack only for the lenses. And fortunately, this camera gave me a great zoom, in a compact size, and a very good resolution. If you are thinking about getting this instead of an SLR probably is not the right choice, but if you just want some quality pictures compared with the 100-200 cameras, this one makes the difference, specially with the great zoom it has, also the screen mobility function is very helpful and in some way "fancy" (I got some complements for that).

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: TSW "akmom1999"
Reviews.Content: This was my first Nikon product.  I researched, read reviews and thought long and hard about the next camera I would buy.  I'm not an expert in cameras or digital photography. I just wanted a good middle ground camera with not so much in the bells and whistles department, but one that took great pictures.  While most cameras these days provide so much assistance to the novice picture-taker, this one proved very weak in that area. It's not my first bridge camera, so I felt I knew my way around a lens, but I found that no matter how I changed settings, tweaked here or there, I could not get decent pictures.  Sometimes it was the coloring that was just plain off, or even at automatic settings, receiving very sub-par results.  I'd read more than a few reviews that said the Nikon Coolpix P100 was cumbersome to navigate, with a less than intuitive user's manual and at this point I must agree.  I wanted to love it, I really did, but in the end, I sold it and went to the Panasonic DMC-FZ47K and am happy with the change.

Reviews.Title: This "bridge" camera is a bridge to nowhere.
Reviews.Author: Jon Prall "JP"
Reviews.Content: The camera is light, has a serious zoom but in general it takes very poor pictures.Its white balance control is a complete mess.  Inside under incandescent light, it is orange.  If you do a manual measurement of white balance, it will get better.  Going into brighter incandescent light will cause the images to become washed out and have a green hue.  The automatic white balance does not work.  Having to do manual white balances for each shot gets old.The ISO management is also very weak.  80% of the time, it will be a grainy picture.My primary camera is a D90 and I have taken thousands of pictures.  I love it.  It is not perfect, but it provides excellent contrast material for the P100.  I figured a P100, with its great reviews, would be an awesome camera for my 10-year-old daughter.  She wants to like it, but she cannot.  She hates the menus and settings, and then she does not like the pictures.  She cannot get any pictures that she would be proud of which is discouraging.I would avoid the lure of the zoom.  It is rare to get that much optical zoom, but it is not worth the poor quality of the pictures in general.

Reviews.Title: No Better Than Average
Reviews.Author: bookworm
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera one year ago and have been very disappointed. The image quality is average for a point and shoot camera, in spite of its good image quality reviews. The indoor image quality is especially bad. I would say below average for even a cheap point and shoot camera, when using the automatic mode. However, it is possible to get average quality indoor pictures if you manually adjust the settings. We wish we would have had our old Canon PowerShot A620 repaired instead of purchasing this camera (its image quality was significantly better).As for the video, we are extremely satisfied. The image quality is excellent. I would even go as far as saying better than the still pictures, at least from an exposure standpoint.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Especially for Those Willing to Learn About the Features!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Segelbaum
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera but you really won't get much out of it if you are just planning to point and shoot all the time and if you aren't going to read the manual.  I used to just point and shoot, but decided with this camera I was going to really read the manual and learn how to use all its great features!  I took it on a cruise to Antarctica with me and spent a few hours the first few days reading all about it, and I learned so much!  Everyone raves about my photos.  The zoom lens is really terrific.  The best approach to getting the most out of this camera is to put some time into it and experiment a LOT with the settings.  Such a great value for the money; I know people who spent 3x as much and are much less happy with their camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Colman "bargain hunter"
Reviews.Content: Nifty little camera.  If you're expecting Nikon digital SLR performance - you won't be satisfied - get a digital SLR.  But, if you're looking to upgrade from their simple point-n-shoot, this is a very good purchase.  Has a lot of the same bells & whistles as the SLR without all the bulk.  Lightweight, easy to handle, and very good photographic results.  Battery life depends on how much zooming in and out you do.  Extra battery packs are cheap, so it never hurts to have a few spare packs charged up and ready to go.Would I prefer a digital SLR?  Sure.  But, for the money and ease of use, this has more than fulfilled everything on my 'want' list.  26X zoom, macro capabilities, several programmable modes and Nikon reliability made this a no-brainer.One thing, and it's a big one....Make sure that you use at least a Class 6 SDHC card or better.  The owner's manual clearly defines this, but I'm not sure if the Amazon description mentions it.  If you want good HD video or the ability to shoot continuous frames in high res, then you need a class 6 or 10 card -- class 4 just won't do.

Reviews.Title: Excellent upgrade from my point-n-shoot!
Reviews.Author: amazonjustice
Reviews.Content: I read through all the reviews, good and the bad. Let's face it, this camera gets lots of bad reviews. Most of the bad reviews are on issues with noise and focusing while video recording. I didn't purchase this camera for the purpose of taking video. I bought it to learn how to use camera features such as aperture, shutter speed, iso, macro, etc. Switching the camera off "auto" and having more creative control over my photos is my goal. This camera is an excellent upgrade from a point-n-shoot. I can't afford an expensive DSLR and find them a bit intimidating. Heck I won't even touch my fiance's SLR. The Nikon P100 can fit into most budgets and is a great way to learn those features the pros talk about.When this camera takes a bad photo there is a good reason. This camera has made me focus on better photograph taking technique. The manual is easy to follow as well as the on camera controls. If your not getting good photos check out tutorials online about the big 3 - Aperture, shutter speed, and ISO. Practice using the features and you will be rewarded with great pictures.Things to take note of: The LCD screen on the back doesn't come with a cover and could get scratch (due to it's position) you might wanna get an LCD screen protector (like the ones you put on your cell phone). Also, If you're interested in using different lens filters on the P100 you need an adapter (I found one for $10).The only reason I am giving this 4 stars instead of 5 is because it doesn't do pictures in RAW format and you need an adapter for filters.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for those far away shots and the close ups
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife0609
Reviews.Content: I researched several different cameras before going with the Nikon CoolPix P100.  I wanted something better than my several year old point and shoot, and the P100 is quite a few steps above it.  It works great for scenery pictures, distance pictures, and fairly close shots of my very active toddler.  I love the 26x optical zoom because I can take pictures of animals from far away and they look like I was standing right next to them.  I would recommend getting at good sized memory card (at least 4 gb, though I prefer 8) because high resolution photos take up a fair amount of space.  I haven't quite figured out the video feature.  I can record and play them back on the camera, but I can't seem to get them to playback correctly on my computer.  It's probably me - not the camera.  One little quirk that I have with it is the battery meter.  I wish it had "bars" like on a cell phone so you could know more accurately how low the battery is.  It shows the battery at the halfway point right up until it dies.  I would like it better if it showed somewhere between half and dead so I would know I definitely needed to charge it.  Overall, it's a great camera.  Simple enough for the point and shoot crowd, yet has plenty of features and settings to please the more experienced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Trapperhunterfisherbob
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I've ever had for just knocking around.  It has all of the features of of an SLR with a zoom lens and auto focus, as well as a viewing screen that folds out and can be viewed from above when using a tripod.  It's like having a Hassalblad and a Minolta in one tidy little package.  It has some kind of electronic lens stabilization and it actually works.  With the 26x zoom extended you can still shoot hand-held and get some pictures that turn out.  If you're used to using a 35mm SLR with auto focus you could pick this thing up and use it without having to look at the manual.  But for the features you would have to, and guess what?  It comes with a printed manual that you can throw in your camera bag for when you do need it.  I'm recommending it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: very happy with my decision
Reviews.Author: happy in Va
Reviews.Content: 2 Nikon EN-EL5 / ENEL5 / CP1 Replacement Battery + Battery Charger Combo Pack FOR Nikon CoolPix 3700 / 4200 / 5200 / 5900 / 7900 / P100 / P3 / P4 / P5000 / P5100 / P6000 / P80 / P90 / S10 Digital SLR CameraZeikos ZE-CA38B Deluxe Soft Small Camera and Video BagTranscend 16 GB Class 6 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS16GSDHC6EI am happy with the camera. It is easy to use. I went to Best Buy to check it out in person and in the store, I felt it was a bit of a  tight grip for my right hand, but once I got it home and used it a few times, I got used to the grip and it's just fine.I mainly got this camera for the zoom. 26x zoom and a good camera for $300 and not $1000.I have a MAC and the pictures load beautifully to iphoto and so easy.The video is pretty good. It does "Shake" a touch if you zoom while taking a movie, but otherwise it is just fine.It comes with a battery and a charger to charge the battery while in the camera.I bought the above charger too. It comes with a wall charger, a car charger and 2 batteries. That is a deal for $4 and I should always have a battery ready to go ( I have 3 now- these 2 and the 1 that came with the camera)It does not come with a SD card, so i got this oneIn Best buy, that same card( 16gb) was about $45.I got a bag too.it fits the camera perfect and has room for the chargers and the extra batteries without being a big bulky camera bag.I was looking for a nicer camera with a good zoom that took nice photos. I think i've found it.My boys and my cats have has MANY pics taken of them since last week....  :)

Reviews.Title: My camera
Reviews.Author: Claudio Herrera
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my new camera. Is a great camera, not a professional one, but have everything I need to take my family pictures.

Reviews.Title: One month user
Reviews.Author: W. Medley
Reviews.Content: After one month, found the camera to do everything they said it would do. Great pictures so far after approximately 500 taken in many different lighting and distances situations.Nikon Coolpix P100 10 MP Digital Camera with 26x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Abrownie90
Reviews.Content: I did my research and found the Nikon to be one of the best options for a novice that had characteristics of a more expensive camera.  Great zoom capability and still a "point and shoot."  So far I've taken a few hundred pictures and the camera has meet or exceeded all of my expectations.  I have a young daughter and needed a camera to catch her on the move and recover quickly and the Nikon has done the job.  I've used the zoom options and have also been pleased with the performance and picture quality.  I have not used or needed the video settings so far.Overall I'm very pleased with the Nikon P100, it is high quality and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!  hx: jury is still out -- might have cause for freezes -- will update
Reviews.Author: SHP
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has quickly taken some great pictures.  Used it with internal memory before ordered SD cards arrived.  Then took it out yesterday with new SD cards.  Camera froze up like described here by others -- locked open, screen and view finder went dark, couldn't turn it on or off.  It only cleared with removal and re-insertion of the battery.  Nothing in manual has been found yet that addresses this.  It was roughly 40 degrees (odd for CT in 12/31!), so it wasn't a temperature issue.HOWEVER, it had worked before without the SD card, so after several 'reboots' I tried removing the SD card after removing the battery.  It worked again!  Internal memory only stores 20 pictures, so not much room to play.  Missed some great shots at a beautifully frozen lake...and went to a local discount store to test my theory that it was the SD card.New card, camera works!  I have not been able to recover the couple of pictures taken on the bad SD card, even through my computer.  The 2nd identical card I bought from the same seller seems to work fine and I'm able to access it via camera and SD reader on the computer.  I do wonder if many of those who thought it was the camera that was bad really had a bad SD card...I just happened to have received the camera before the ordered SD cards so had already used it with internal memory.One clear disadvantage -- my old kodak point and shoot could switch between SD card and internal memory while in use and in playback.  This, more advanced, camera cannot -- you have to remove the SD card to access the internal memory.Check this before returning your camera!---2/3/11  Will update with more details in the future, but I LOVE this camera!  Have taken some great pictures with it and it has been easy to learn.  No freezes since not using defective SD card. (I should place a link here to THAT review.......!)BTW, reading the manual is not a bad thing........You CAN review pics without the lens being off........With camera off and lens covered, press and hold the review button.........Will edit later and add page reference in manual.:-)

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: Nikhil R. Bhandari
Reviews.Content: Very good buy. I have been using a 7 megapixel point & shoot camera, but couldn't get clear pics during night. Then I went for Nikon P100. P100 works very good. It has rechargable battery, HD video, 26x zoom and very powerful flash.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera- i like it
Reviews.Author: PSengar
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my decision to buy this camera. It has very good picture quality, good controls, excellent zoom, adjustable screen. In addition to good pictures, the video recording quality is excellent. I would recommend this camera to all.

Reviews.Title: Point & Shoot with style...
Reviews.Author: Simple Nature
Reviews.Content: I must say, I am fairly impressed in what time does to a product line.  I am easily impressed with gadgets and gizmo's and this one is feature packed for the cost.I looked at this camera at the local camera shop and compared it to the Nikon Coolpix L110 and the 1st thing that stood out was the viewfinder with the diopter adjustment... I know - the "What?"... well this deserves mention.  If your eyes are less than perfect and you can't read the giant 3" view screen, you will be able to focus on the display in the viewfinder.  That is what the diopter does; this feature lets you focus within the view finder without using your glasses or bifocals.And whats more; this camera is simply feature packed.  Automatic scene selection?!  I was able move the camera and still take nice images; do you know what 26x zoom is capable of?  WOW!  And the full HD 1080p movie mode is a real bonus.  The high speed movie mode, up to 240fps is a nice novelty but limited in recording time making it just that, a novelty.In case you are wondering which memory card to order; Nikon recommends a Class 6 or better.I'm really looking forward to making the best of this camera beyond the simple point & shoot I'm use to.  Once you review the 200 page manual and get familiar with all the goodies within this camera, you will need to learn how to make use of these on the fly while your muse patiently waits for you to dial in all the available settings for that optimum exposure.For the money, this is a nice little camera that has its place between the pocket camera and the DSLR kit.

Reviews.Title: Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: Radha Lavakrishnan "krish"
Reviews.Content: i purchesed this product on blackfriday deal. i think spending $300 dollars for 26X zoom, wide angle is very reasonable, i recommend people to use tripod to take fully zoomed pictures.

Reviews.Title: Converting from 35mm to digital
Reviews.Author: Richmond Virginia
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for only a month. I feel the picture quality is excellent and the weight is much better than my 35mm that it replaced. Look forward to learning and using all of the functions of the camera in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Omar Castellanos "Omix"
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera. It has what I need and what I was expecting. I didn't get any of the reported errors and have been taking tons of pictures and videos(hope 240fps size videos could be bigger).I really recommend this camera!!!*I uploaded some pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera - truly market leader
Reviews.Author: Souvik Sinha
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a friend, who is absolutely stunned by the performance of this camera. It has great low-light performance. The daylight photos are as usual legendary Nikon quality. I'll give 10/10 to this marvelous camera. And 26x optical zoom - that just blew all other competitors away!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: sootshouse
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few months ago and was nervous b/c I had read reviews that talked about error messages, zoom freezing issues, low light problems.  I haven't had any error messages or problems with the zoom.  This camera had to pass the concert test.  I go to a lot of concerts and with my old Kodak 10X camera (Z612), I would take 60 picutres and would be lucky if I got 5 okay pictures and that was only after having to use photoshop to brighten the pictures.  The P100 totally passed the test!  I take the same amount of pictures and don't even have to use Photoshop to fix anything about most of the pictures.  I learned quickly that the best way to take photos at concerts is to use either subject tracking or a manual setting.  I don't even use a flash at a concert and still get great shots, even using the zoom.  With my old Kodak, the more zoom I used, the worse the picture and the darker it was.  I know that I have a lot to learn about the camera settings.I bought 2 generic batteries and a generic charger so that I don't have to charge the battery in the camera if I don't want to.  The charger I bought even has a usb port so I can charge my cell phone at the same time.  The battery life could be longer but that's probably b/c I review my pictures too much!As for the video, I haven't really had a chance to use it.  I tried using a Class 4 card and while it looked great on the camera, the speed wasn't fast enough when it was uploaded to the computer.  Therefore, on playback, while the sound quality was perfect, the video is choppy.  I need to get a Class 6 memory card and try that out.I love this camera and total recommend it.UPDATE ON THE VIDEO:  Still having trouble.  The video is of a clip from a concert - about 1 minute. It looks great on replay on the camera but then once transferred to the computer, the video picture is jerky and doesn't keep up w/ the music. The music is perfect sounding. First I used a 4GB SDHC memory card but it was a Class 4. So I bought an 8GB SDHC memory card which is a class 6. Both brands of cards are recommended in the back of the book. I figured my problem was that I had used a Class 4 when it said I needed a Class 6. But the Class 6 actually seemed to do a worse job than the class 4. Any idea what the heck I am doing wrong? I download pictures and video using the camera cord connected to the computer. The only thing I can think of is that I never downloaded the NIKON software to my computer b/c I currently use a different software for uploading. Could that be my problem? I wouldn't think that it would matter. HELP!!!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: jrhalpha
Reviews.Content: This camera has exceeded all my expectations. I had looked at the Canon. But after hours of research, the Nikon seemed to be better. I am so glad I got the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Good step up!
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: The Coolpix P100 is a very versatile camera which can produce excellent photos. I reviewed multiple cameras in my search for my new addition, including standard point and shoots and SLRs. This camera is highly rated by consumer reports (Aug. 2010) in all areas.I was looking for a camera that could still be used with automatic settings but also had the options to be in control of settings. This camera has numerous settings for different situations that suit the beginner to the person, such as myself, who is trying to become a better photographer.  This is a camera that you can learn how to manipulate settings to create photos that you are seeking. I think I will be more knowledgeable and ready for an SLR when the time arises.ProsHigh quality photos, sturdy feel, user friendly menus and functioning buttons. The LCD screen moves which means I don't have to lay on the ground to shoot a low, upward facing photo. I just adjust the LCD screen. Great zoom range (26x) which goes well beyond the standard 3x you normally get.ConsZoom is a little touchy so you have to work at nudging it to not have it zoom really quick. You also can't take your battery out and charge it seperately which suprised me. You can either charge it via USB port on your computer or use the adaptor to charge at the wall. Either way your camera is sitting out exposed while charging and that makes me nervous.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Good Price
Reviews.Author: Henry Page "Tech Weak"
Reviews.Content: I am a "point and shoot" guy and when I have to make manual adjustments using the menu it seems to be user friendly.  The ISO, for example, is a quick adjustment and then back to auto easily done. I took about 100 pictures at a Jazz concert using manual adjustments and they came out very nice... a dark theater and brightly lit stage. The zoom works well,however when you get out to maximum you need to be very careful when you pull the trigger. A mono pod would be helpful to eliminate ruining the shot. I really like the camera. The neck strap is uncomfortable and I'll need to find something else, but that's a minor complaint. The "look" and weight of the camera are perfect. I own a full size expensive DSLR with a heavy lens that will now gather dust in the closet..My first digital camera was 1.3 Mps and this is a big improvment from those days. Get one, you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely wonderful...
Reviews.Author: J. DiGiovanna
Reviews.Content: I am a click and shoot kind of guy. Had a Canon AE1 25 years ago - adjust this, set the F stop, focus, change lens - NOT anymore. Went from a small Sony click and shoot to this Nikon P100. Love it. Does everything a more expensive SLR camera does and does it automatically.

Reviews.Title: A lot for a little
Reviews.Author: Robert K. Baldwin
Reviews.Content: How can you beat a camera that does all this and cost so little?  Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA!!!!!
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: My review is mainly for the picture quality.  This camera was purchased as a gift to my niece for her 16th birthday.  She is very much into photography, and taking close-up shots of nature...flowers, birds, etc, is one of her favorite things to do.  She is absolutely crazy about this camera, between the shutter speed, the clarity of the pictures and the zoom, it's just UNBELIEVEABLE!!! I have only seen the pictures, which have been amazing, but haven't seen any video.  The reason for me giving this camera 5 stars for everything is, for the price and quality of the camera, you will not find anything else on the market that can compare to this camera without buying the extra lenses.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Cephus Adams "Cephus"
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera!  I've only had it a few days and so far none of the problems that were mentioned in previous reviews!  I love the picture and video quality!  Sure, I'm a novice, so I don't notice the "noise" or other things that I've read about.  There may be a better camera out there, but for now...I'm loving my Nikon P100!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars for this camera, everything I could want and more.....
Reviews.Author: J. Rexroat "The one and only"
Reviews.Content: This camera does so much, and I don't have to lug around extra lenses of attachments. The zoom is amazing and the quality of the pictures is never an issue. They come out very brigt and crisp, and even realistic if I must say. I abosultely love having the option of the EVF too. I didn't think I would use it much and now I use it pretty often. The LCD screen on the camera is  very bright and show the colors very well. I can't believe how small the camera actually is. I can use one hand to take pictures and the other hand to hold my drink....lol. When you do zoom in all the way you will want to have something to rest the camera on if you want a perfect shot. It's doesn't have to be a tripod, just something more stable than your floating hand. Also, if you use the EVF when zooming that will help stable the camera too.I always told myself that I would never take the leap to spend this much on a camera. Well, I am glad I did and its been worth every penny. My only issue is that Nikon didn't make a case for this camera. I would have gladly paid another $30 for a custom made camera case.Either way though, I am so please with this purchase!!!! Thank you Nikon!!!!

Reviews.Title: Wanted so badly to like it
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Hope
Reviews.Content: I wanted so very badly to like this camera.  I've spent the last 2 or 3 months researching higher-end point-and-shoots, narrowing my choices down to the Canon sx30is, the Nikon s8100 (just because it was getting such rave reviews), and the Nikon P100.  I finally decided on the P100, despite reading some so-so reviews, including those whose cameras locked up on them.  I figured that wouldn't happen to me.I purchased the camera at Costco for an amazing deal (which also came w/a case and memory card -- great deal).  The next morning I opened it up, charged the battery 'til full, and tried it out.  I only played with it for about 5 minutes before it locked up on me.  It froze with the lens extended and wouldn't turn off or respond to any buttons, so I finally had to remove the battery.  It worked fine after that but I paid over $300 for this camera and I sure don't want one that's unreliable.  (I also noticed the zoom felt "off"... it was really sluggish zooming in and when zooming back out it was very fast.  I also noticed zoomed in shots with flash turned out gorgeous, but those w/o flash were blurry??)So now I'm torn.  I feel like this camera has an incredible amount of potential, but do I take the risk of purchasing another?  Or do I go to a different brand or model?  I'm tempted to try a second, but perhaps there are just too many technical issues with this model to give it another go.  Any other suggestions for something similar in style, price, features, etc.?

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera so far
Reviews.Author: Shiny
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes great pictures and it is super easy to use. It has a great zoom and action shots are amazing. I love the vivid color option. I am also pleased with the video. It takes an SD card but even without it the internal storage will hold a couple hundred pictures (when not in the highest quality setting). It has a rechargable battery and charger is 110-240V which I find to be a huge plus because I do a lot of traveling in the UK. I also like the size. It is not very heavy and small enough to handle easily. This is my fourth digital camera and by far my favorite. I started with a Nikon about 6 years ago but decided to "upgrade" to an expensive Kodak which I didn't like at all. Too hard to control, too many automatic settings that you couldn't over ride, horrible action shots. We also own a Sony which is useless. I am very pleased and would happily recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P100 is Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Dale
Reviews.Content: I got this camera about a month ago.  I have been working with it since then.  It has been great.  The photo quality has been outstanding.  The camera is absolutely unbelievable in low light conditions.  The zoom lens really allows you to get difficult long range shots without having to carry a number of large heavy lenses with you.  The weight of the camera is suprisingly light.  The controls are well laid out and HD video is a really fantastic feature and the quality and sound of the pictures is really great.  I have tried other extended zoom cameras and the Nikon P100 is really ahead of the others in terms of photo quality and camera features.  Try this camera, you will like it.

Reviews.Title: Big Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Marc Liberts
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for the long zoom for our trip to Alaska and for LA Dodger games and concerts. It has been great for Dodger games! From our seats, we get great images of the players using the huge opitcal zoom. It was ok in Alaska. I own 2 Nikon DSLRs and although the controls are similar, they are different enough that I have to go back and read the instructions, so I'm not loving the controls or ergonomics.  The image quality is good, but not great. I love the weight because its much lighter than I thought it would be. I don't do much video, but the video quality is surprisingly excellent, especially with the optical zoom. Camera shake is a problem at max zoom with the video, so we need to get a small tripod or something like that. Picture quality at ISO 800+ is not great. Below 800, picture quality is good, but not great. The best thing about this camera is the huge optical zoom and the video. The pictures are just ok so far.

Reviews.Title: My Nikon P100 - Did I get the bad apple in the bunch?
Reviews.Author: Sherry Miller
Reviews.Content: I received the Nikon P100 for my birthday in mid March.  It is the first Nikon camera I have ever owned.  In the 5 months I have owned the P100, it has been in Nikon service for 2 OF THOSE MONTHS.  Each time Nikon had my camera for repairs, they replaced a whole list of parts and both times I received the camera back in far worse condition.  The more they work on it and replace parts the worse it gets.  And for some reason they keep sending it back to me with more and more problems and issues.  Unbelievable.  After spending another 2 hours on the phone with Nikon Tech Support, I was told the camera had to be sent back again.  So, for the THIRD TIME, I  sent the camera to them.  I was told they would let me know if they decide to replace it or try to fix it again.  Seriously.  My response to this statement was that if they COULD fix it then they WOULD have.  It wasn't fair to ask me to wait while they tried to fix it for the THIRD TIME.  They need to just replace it with a new camera.  In the meantime, I was asked to send a few of the pictures for Nikon to analyze.  The response I received from a Nikon supervisor said that the pictures I sent were bad because of the settings used and the composition.  For the glare problem, he instructed me NOT to face toward the sun when taking pictures.  He also suggested a setting to use for indoor low light conditions and asked me to try that and let him know how it works.  How insulting!  Wow.  Nikon is blaming me for all the picture and camera problems and not taking any responsibility for the fact that in the 8 weeks they have had my camera for repairs they were never able to fix it - and, in fact, made it worse and still sent it back to me like there was no problem.  And I can't very well try a different setting on a camera that I do not have - and this Nikon supervisor knew that the camera had been sent back.  When is Nikon going to take responsibility for their product and stand behind it?  They need to accept the fact that I just happened to get the one bad apple in the bunch.  I've already gone 8 weeks (and counting) without the use of my camera.  They've already had 2 chances to fix it and they haven't.  They need to replace it with a new camera before the last shred of respect - and confidence - I have for Nikon is gone.  This isn't exactly how I thought my first experience with a Nikon camera would turn out.  Not a fan of the camera, Nikon, tech support, or their service department now.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Worth Every Penny
Reviews.Author: Madonna's Fan #1E+34.6g
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera last March 2010, there were no reviews yet.  When I got it and finally worked out the basic features (I'm a novice), I was astonished with its ability.  The moon pictures I got were amazing.  Originally I only intended on replacing my old camera basically just for special occasions and the odd holiday or event.  It was quickly obvious the power was literally astronomical.  I got pics of Orion's Nebula (the little purple star in Orion is actually a beautiful nebula and this camera picked it up beautifully).  The Seven Sisters (Pleiades / the Heart of Taurus) showed up like bright blue sapphires when I zoomed in really close.  It took me a minute to figure out how to make it auto-focus on such dim and distant objects, but it eventually worked and shocked me.  I can pick up Jupiter's Gallilean moons!The timer is essential and works perfectly with the 2s or 10s option.  Very handy and simple.  The lighting settings are also useful when taking shots of the moon when it is dimmer or brighter.The aperture mode makes for great still pictures up close and far away.  I haven't really used the other features enough to comment on how good they are or are not.  The video feature is great, but I need to figure out how to get it into compressed avi and I haven't got that skill yet.If I had to buy another camera, it would have to be AT LEAST as good as this camera or I won't buy it.  I'll just get another Nikon CoolPix P100!  I'm completely 100% satisfied with this product and the purchasing process.

Reviews.Title: disappointing photo quality
Reviews.Author: VTgrandma
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this camera.  I was replacing a five year old Canon and thought this would be a step up in quality.  After a few uses, I wish I had stayed with Canon.  This camera is cumbersome to handle, and the flimsy plastic parts may not last under frequent use.  The view screen cannot be seen under sunny conditions, a huge drawback.  The worst of it is that the image quality is poor, very blurry no matter how the photo is shot.  Maybe an ungraded SD card would help, but I hesitate to put any more money into a product which didn't produce acceptable results.

Reviews.Title: grate camera
Reviews.Author: jimbo
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I'm a sailor who loves to take pictures while on the open water.  Quick response, maximum zoom and stability are a must when sea creature are playing on the horizon.  The P100 delivers.  Rarely do I miss a shoot.  It not unusual for me to take 100 to 200 pictures while sailing.Summary.  I appreciate a camera that does it's job while I'm focused on the shot.  Memories made easy is what this camera is about.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Candice
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT camera, it's just that I happened to receive a defective one! The memory card slot would not recognize any memory cards so we had to send it back. Fortunately Amazon is very good about their returns. They immediately emailed me a UPS label to return my defective camera and are shipping me another one! Hopefully I'll be able to get the full experience of how great this camera can be when I can put a memory card in it and take more than 15 pictures at a time!

Reviews.Title: What a great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Stafford Conley
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and produces great photos.  I am extremely pleased with its performance!!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Fatima
Reviews.Content: I really loved this camera. It has a lot of useful and nice features, and its manual helps to understand and use them. I took really good pictures and excellent fullHD videos! I just faced two problems that i couldn't solve till now:1. Depending of the light is difficult to obtain focus, but it could be my fault, 'cause I'm still learning about the camera;2. While I was recording a fullHD video was difficult to get focus when i use the zoom.

Reviews.Title: Some great features some poor design
Reviews.Author: Christy N. Butler Photos "CNB"
Reviews.Content: First, I like the 26 mm to 675 mm (26X ) optical zoom, yet why did they create the lens cap off only to turn it on?  Then, I really selected this P100 for the variable 3" LCD screen, but it's not as flexible as the 8400 or 8800 smaller LCD screen.  So far the features, menu's and control layout are easily accessed and function for me flawlessly.  High 1080 video is excellent, but the still images in JPEG have only (3) savings selects low/norm/fine would have been nice to maintain the Extra Fine settings I have on the 8800/8400.  In addition, the P100 ISO lowest setting is 160, compare to the 8800/8400's lower ISO setting of 50.
