The comparison of images saved in Extra Fine at ISO 50 is very apparent in details and sharpness compared to P100's which seem a little fuzzy.  Plus, having no hot shoe for accessories such as external flash or bubble level is another demerit, another demerit for no ability to utilize any sort of screw on filter such as UV/polarization or neutral density.In defense, it has a great lens, lots of zoom here, focus systems are terrific, Video twice..no 3X's better than 640x480 and with a instant video select button.  Finally, the shutter release button is very very crisp compared to any digital compact I have had yet.All for now, I'm keeping it.  Gave it only 4 stars for Nikon needs to get a grip on total design.Update: March 2011.  Excellent camera, glad I have one.  I adjust everything to suit my need, burst is terrific at full rez.  Low light very good.  Full control of shutter, color, F-stop.  Video is great in low light.  Although, old computer Win XP did not play 1080p smoothly.  New Computer Win7 no problems.  SHot all day, winter weather filled an 8 gig card with Full rez and movies only 1 battery change.  Still wish they(Nikon) had designed this with hot-shoe, filters and remote attachment for smooth shutter releases with hi-telephoto.CNB

Reviews.Title: Lens freezes
Reviews.Author: Cathrine Summer
Reviews.Content: Only had the camera a few years and the focus was not working correctly and then the lens froze and we could not take pictures.Sent the camera out for repair and came back with an estimate of $165.00.... It was just not worth it.  Find a newer camera the don't make this one anymore.....

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money and great for low light conditions
Reviews.Author: agranados777
Reviews.Content: The zoom is amazing on this camera, 27x! Good performance in low light conditions, overall it is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Digital SLR like cameras are great but have strengths and weaknesses
Reviews.Author: JacK Trades
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for decently high quality photographs.  The best feature was that it has an actual viewfinder.  This is nice if you have older eyes and can't make out the LCD screen in harsh sunlight conditions.  I'm old and old school and like having a viewfinder even for snapshots.  Admittedly I'm more likely to just grab ye olde smartphone these days for snapshots because it's conveniently handy.

Reviews.Title: Fantatstic caemra
Reviews.Author: Mark B.
Reviews.Content: At first I chose the Nikon Coolpix for price. When I started to use it found it to be a wonderful and first rate digital camera. It is a wonderful addition to my collection. I use it almost daily!

Reviews.Title: Great camera with awesome zoom
Reviews.Author: Bill_OKC
Reviews.Content: This camera works great, and the zoom is awesome and exactly what the doctor ordered.  I was sick of going to school functions and getting awful pictures of the school band and my kids.  With this camera, I could zoom right into my child and get all sorts of nice pictures.  Sure, I've had better cameras, but they've been 10x more expensive as well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Miller "professional Grandparent"
Reviews.Content: Great all around camera. Im a house inspector and take 100's of shots in each house I inspect. Since I purchased this camera in 2011 I have probably taken 10,000 or more photos with it. Im not a photo tech guy but out of the box this camera has performed great. Im retiring it to upgrade to a Coolpix that gives a higher optical zoom but  it will remain as my backup camera till it breaks.Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P100 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: tom2tess
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera, very easy to use. The feature I feally love is it takes color and black and white photos at the same time.

Reviews.Title: One of the best for its time
Reviews.Author: B. Fong "shinboy"
Reviews.Content: This was one of my favorite cameras that I recently departed with.  I use my DSLR much more now so I gave it to a friend because it was be neglected.  In some instances the image quality would be similar to a DSLR if you are not a pixel peeper.  The body was small, light, and easily fit into my small/medium sized hands.  Looks can be deceiving because this camera packed a large 26x zoom in the small body.  It is a great walk-around camera because of its versatility.  You can take up close up portraits up all the way up birds several hundred meters away.  Battery life would last a whole day but the only negative is that the battery was charged in the body.  The EVF was very nice to use especially if you take very long zoom shots which can help with stability.  One of the few gripes with this camera is that pictures can turn out soft, noise reduction can be very prominent, and some focus hunting at long range.  Overall one of best and funnest cameras I have ever owned.  I have churned out lots of great pictures and videos.  The autofocus is quick, image stabilization works well in long range shots, the camera has lots of features to try out, and the screen flips out.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P100 10MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Szymczak "Rob"
Reviews.Content: 2nd buy of same camera from same vendor. Does a good job but I have noticed that this one seems to have a little more trouble focusing than the other one which I gave to my Mom. This one occasionally will show green (meaning in focus) in the view finder, but it isn't in focus as you look thru the view finder. Just re-zoom and it seems to correct, but the other camera never exhibited this problem. It's been an occasional problem that has been easy to work around for now, but if it gets worse then I my regret this 2nd time buy. Other than that, it's a great camera......I buy this Nikon for the articulated 3" display screen. Works great for shooting overhead in a crowd.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Item at a Perfect Price
Reviews.Author: H. Hartman "I don't have time to actually rea...
Reviews.Content: I bought mine used for $120. It came in like new, with no problems. It's been to two different countries, and the pictures have been of excellent quality. I honestly couldn't have asked for anything better!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera But Not Very Durable
Reviews.Author: N. Sikora
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera, it was like an extension of me.  The Sports Continuous setting was great for catching that amazing leap into the lake; my landscape pictures were wonderful; it took crisp, clear portraits.  I can't say I was particularly impressed with the sharpness at the far end of the zoom, but I don't take lots of small wildlife photos, so that wasn't a problem.  This camera is a great compromise between a DSLR and a pocket camera, being smaller and lighter than the DSLR and having more versatility than the pocket cameras-- and has a look-through viewfinder in addition to the view screen, which is helpful in bright sunlight conditions.The main problem with this camera is that it is made of lightweight plastic and is not particularly durable.  I used to shoot with a manual film SLR camera which got banged around all the time and still worked and was relatively unaffected by moisture (e.g. rain.)  And I've dropped pocket cameras with no ill effect.  But this one froze on me one time when it got splashed with pool water.  I did get it working again, but then one day it fell out of my daypack when I was on my way out the door to climb a peak.  The lens was ruined :-(  I've contemplated getting another one, but I think I'm going to have to save the money to upgrade to a small DSLR instead.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Ronald Richardson
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA! BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR MY WIFE AND SHE REALLY LOVES IT. THE ZOOM IS REALLY NICE. SHE SAYS THIS ONE IS A KEEPER.

Reviews.Title: Newer model is better
Reviews.Author: Berny
Reviews.Content: by the time i wrote this the difference between P100 and P510 was $30, if you want to save that its ok the P100 has very good quality, zoom and everything else but the P510 is much,much better.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend this anytime anyday.
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Ann Mc Donald
Reviews.Content: Oh how i wish it was Christmas again, where i can purchase  as gifts for my family so they can experience how great this camera works.

Reviews.Title: Simply Great!
Reviews.Author: Andres Leonardo
Reviews.Content: I buy this camera for a friend, and the status is Perfect! He is hapy with your new camera, all funtionalities are amazing, 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: great budget camera
Reviews.Author: jgalloway79
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying if you want DSLR results, buy a DSLR camera. If you're like me and you're looking for a really good point and shoot that has great zoom capability, then you won't be dissapointed at all. I use this camera to take pictures of my kids and also for landscape pictures. It works great for both. Low light photos are the best I've seen in a point and shoot. Shutter response is terrific. I have pictures of my son in mid swing playing T ball that are professional looking. The panorama function works very well as long as there is enough distance between you and the subject, otherwise there is some curvature. The video quality is phenominal as well. The sound isn't the best, but it's passable. It does well enough that I decided against buying a camcorder, opting to just use the camera. I've had this camera for almost 2 years now, and i still love it. Buddy of mine recently purchased a high end canon point and shoot with 35X zoom and i believe 14mp. We took pictures side by side and this Nikon performed just as well and in some cases better than the canon. The only advantage the canon had was in zoom capacity. But the Nikon actually took better pictures at full zoom due to a better image stabilizer. Don't pay attention to the negative reviews, some of these people are expecting results like those from expensive DSLR's. You're not gonna get that from any point and shoot. But if you want a camera that performs extremely well for under $400, you will be very happy. Also, just a suggestion, but if you choose to purchase the p100 I would highly reccomend buying the external battery charger. You can pick one up with an extra battery for less than $20 if you shop it.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Deffeyes "Amateur photographer"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix P100 10 MP Digital Camera with 26x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3-Inch LCD (Black)I own a big Nikon SLR which does great fine art photography. I also own the Nikon Coolpix P100. We recently went on a three week cruise in Spain, North Africa, Canary Islands, Madiera, and Portugal. I took ONLY the P100 because it is so small, light and easy to manage. The range of photos I took went from inside caves, night scenes, blazing mid-day sun, cathedral interiors, out of bus windows, etc. The P100 does it all and the pictures are great. What a joy to operate as the camera shifts from automatic to completely manual depending on the demands of the scene. With the 26 to 1 zoom lens, you can photograph shots that others would miss. Long focal lengths dictate extra camera stability and the Nikon vibration reduction system pitches in to keep camera motion from spoiling your shots. I shot hand held pictures inside a cathedral at 1.3 seconds exposure. Not recommended, but there was no alternative and the P100 with some careful holding of the camera came through with good pictures. Nothing is perfect. The thing I missed was the ability to use a polarizing filter mounted on the camera. Sort of awkward to have to manage. I asked one pro how to manage, he said "hold the camera steady with your left hand under the body of the camera, with the right hand press the shutter release while you hold the polarizing filter with the other hand ." Er, ah, not so good. I would set the camera for a 10 second delay, press the shutter release and then hold the filter over the lens. Not too smooth, but it works. The tilt back also allows some photo angles that I would have missed otherwise. All in all, the P100 is a really great travel companion. I heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: bzlady414
Reviews.Content: It works so much better if you take the time to read the instructions. It even worked pretty well when I didn't read the instructions. I am a real rookie regarding cameras so I really needed to practice with it and I am still having fun trying new things. Took great pictures on my trip to Belize and Israel.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful! Almost 3 years old and looks like new.
Reviews.Author: laughalot
Reviews.Content: I received this product for Christmas in 2010. This was was my first real,good picture taking camera. I haven't had the need to replace it yet! The picture is very clear and the camera is very user-friendly. The only thing I would change would be the action sports setting. It takes to long to load the sequence of pictures, but I don't use it much anyway. Clear, picture perfect camera. I love Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for my work
Reviews.Author: T Robbins
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer for one of General Electric's jet engine refurbishment facilities, because photos are an easy and cheap way for them to record how an engine comes in, the repair work done, and the way it looks when it ships out, in order to protect the company's reputation and business. As such, my work demands top-notch definition and the ability to focus on minute details if I need to, as well as the ability to tilt the screen so I can see over the enormous jet engines I photograph on a daily basis.This camera excels in those roles and works well for what I do with it. The ability to tilt the screen is invaluable, because the engines I photograph are about six feet in diameter and I have to get a top-down shot of the entire engine when I photograph them. The gantrys we have aren't all tall enough to see over them with, so I have to rely on the tilting screen.The ability of this camera to get closeup photos of small details is also invaluable, as part of my job entails catching the tiniest flaws in the inner workings of the engine, such as nicks on the compressor blades. A couple days ago I caught a nick in the blade that was no bigger than the thickness of my fingernail, and when I downloaded the pictures later I saw it on the screen, plain as day, with no adjustment or manipulation of the photo required.I really appreciate this camera, and would recommend it to anyone who needs a camera for detail work or photographing machinery.

Reviews.Title: Some nice features, but image quality is poor in several instances.
Reviews.Author: JES "gadget lover"
Reviews.Content: I use the camera for wildlife/scenic shots mostly, some indoor, but mostly outdoors.  That was the reason I wanted this with the long zoom range.  While it does do several things well(great macro, good zoom) I am very unhappy with the quality of the image for outdoor shots on a sunny day.  Everything is washed out.  I have tried the auto scene, specific scene, aperature priority, shutter priority and program mode, but still my outdoor shots are grainy and washed out and unacceptable.  I have a few weeks before my one year is up and I am wondering if I may have a bad camera.  I have had two Canon powershots before this one and they were excellent in terms of image quality, but both experienced problems with the zoom lens motor(or motor gear).  That was why I tried the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: I'm Happy with this Camera
Reviews.Author: PhotoFan
Reviews.Content: The review's that I read before purchasing this camera were very helpful. This is my 2nd Nikon.Once again, I am NOT disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Color, WB accuracies are both very poor - ruined my vacation
Reviews.Author: truthoflife
Reviews.Content: This camera (Nikon P100) cannot handle the situations listed below, the automatic white balance and color accuracy of yellows and greens is very inaccurate. Please see the sunset photo i've uploaded. The camera will probably ruin your "golden hour" photos. It is ok in broad daylight, where the sky is accurate but has low saturation.1. Sunsets: The sky end up with a pink cast, all the orange and red hues are irrecoverably lost (no RAW option).2. Skin tomes with late evening sun (the golden hour)are either too pink or too green, white walls are usually pink.3. Indoors without flash in any lighting, especially diffuse sunlight gives photos a pink cast that cannot be removed from the jpeg file. It is acceptable if you use flash.4. Detail in distant foliage is non-existent - the noise reduction and jpeg compression smudge all detail.5. Highlights in clouds during daytime are usually lost, unless you are looking directly opposite the sun6. Portraits in any common light - fine skin tones, contrast and hues are non-existent, the face is just one near uniformly colored watercolor portrait with lots of magenta or green depending on your luck with the WB.The hardware was very responsive and fast. There are a host of other impressive features which all mean nothing to me since the basic image quality is horrible.I bought this at BestBuy a day before leaving on an overseas vacation, only to promptly return it after it ruined all vacation photos. Instead i bought a Canon T2i and a 15-85 EF-S lens from Amazon. Note that I am not a fanboy - I have a Canon T2i and a Nikon D70 both of which are great cameras, the D70 being my favorite due to its great ergonomics, image quality & battery life. I also have a canon S90 that is a great p&s; camera.

Reviews.Title: very good camera, very happy with the results
Reviews.Author: RJ photography
Reviews.Content: The bottom line is that everything I wanted a great photo of I did get. great lake shots, full moon and 1/4 moon shots..with all craters showing excellentshadows, The first snow photo's were wonderful...This camera makes me look like a professional.RJ

Reviews.Title: Does not capture pictures fast
Reviews.Author: Tink Thinks
Reviews.Content: I bought this really wanting to love it. However, I don't. I wish now I had saved a little more and got a Cannon. This camera is just to slow for me. I bought the best card you could get and it didn't improve the processing at all. It is a solid 5 slow seconds between shots. My sisters Cannon shoots 10 shots a second. My camera captures a lot of blur, low light photos are horrible without flash. The 16 shot mode which I thought would be individual rapid pictures is just a single photo with 16 photos compiled together. I would pass on this one and get a Cannon!

Reviews.Title: Over 3 years and I still LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: pharden87
Reviews.Content: I *love* this camera.I've had it for over 3 years and got it when I decided I wanted nicer pictures, and more control over those pictures - but at the same time didn't really want to go through the hassle of learning and the cost of getting a DSLR.Before getting this camera I found that every year I felt like I wanted a newer or better camera, and I've yet to feel the urge to replace this one.People are constantly asking me what kind of camera I use, and I am always more than happy to tell them and then to point them to the newer available models.Oh and battery life - mine is awesome. I use it for long periods of time all the time and I so rarely have to charge the battery that I often forget to when it actually does die.The one con I can think of - it is really hard to get good pictures using the flash. They almost always turn out just eh.

Reviews.Title: just what i ordered
Reviews.Author: Josef
Reviews.Content: Very good experience. Received the camera in promised time and it was just what I ordered. It works fine, so far.

Reviews.Title: Best Gift Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: YoungAnge
Reviews.Content: My mom bought me this camera when I graduated college and I lost it. My husband heard me talking about how much I wanted it and bought me this one from here! I <3 <3 <3 it! I have read through the entire manual and have tried all sorts of techniques with it. I am not a professional photographer by any means, but this one does make my basic pictures come out a million times better than my basic digital camera that I've had for years. I love this camera and can not wait to take it out to the woods and try it out!

Reviews.Title: Set ISO range and shoot in manual - not bad at all
Reviews.Author: summulus
Reviews.Content: Have shot about 10,000 frames, so far.  Not overly impressed by primary AF mode (particularly at wide angle even with distortion control engaged to remove barreling inherent to lens).  Slight softness overall - but this can be cleaned up, most of the time, post-processing).  Manual focus takes a bit of time to get the hang of, but is worth the trouble (diopter could have been fed more pixels) have compared many shots of same subjects taken in both AF & manual and get sharper images overall when I hit the right spot using manual focus - getting better at that.  Very good in auto at macro/tele.  Also like the fact that the x4 dig. zoom produces acceptable images; however (hear myself quoting from the Wild Bunch) `it must be mounted on a tripod!', though minimal stabilization (elbows against the glass of the window for vid linked to) in vid mode serves well (youtube:  Gavnost21: Wild Eastern Turkeys/ shot handheld at 1280 through glass and fencing - last 5 sec. to reveal distance).Also use a Canon T3i.  Will pick this up at home to shoot clearer images in more questionable lighting conditions (high contrast differential) but won't carry it into the woods (not as versatile under less than optimal conditions - without a porter to haul the gear).Maybe Nikon will provide another firmware upgrade for this puppy that will sharpen the soft edges but, regardless, an excellent little bridge camera that improves with understanding of the features provided.As always: RTFM/YMMV

Reviews.Title: Just a Great Bridge Camera
Reviews.Author: Howard Frierman
Reviews.Content: Not only is the P1 by nikon a truly great camera, but the place i purchased it from, keh camera, in georgia (i think) was equally as wonderful, shipping it out the same day and it was in my  hands within only a few days. all companies should be this dedicated to great customer service. thanks, keh......i am a new convert and will always check with you guys first before shopping anywhere else.the camera is just phenomenal; great quality, great images, i have no complaints. except i am not sure if this camera features flash burst (like the panasonic series),  and i wish it did cause it  is very helpful to take a quick series of fast photos indoors in questionable light. but other  than that, a great camera that i truly love.

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it!
Reviews.Author: J. Kenneth Byrd "Southern Gentleman"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas gift for my wife.  She had been hinting that she wanted a camera with a decent zoom and fairly high megapixels.  I researched several models and trusted the Nikon name.  It is provides nice, crisp pictures of our children and many other events.  We have been very pleased with the zoom, and quite surprised at how well it functions.  As always, Amazon had the best price I could find.

Reviews.Title: Best camera in the world!!!!
Reviews.Author: Camera luver
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras in the world i just love it so muchThe movable screen is like the coolest featureThe 10 mp is so clearNice macroFast picture takingLong lasting lastes me bout 2 daysI dont know a camera i can get better then this

Reviews.Title: good, but not as good as I was hoping
Reviews.Author: jh
Reviews.Content: good:- good photos overall for non-slr, but not as good as I was hoping.  digital camera picture quality hasn't improved much (if at all) over the past few years- good quality flash pictures- low light photos are descent for non-slr, seems better than Panasonics I've used, but comparable to canons- hd video works well (sd speed class must be 6 or faster - I used a Transcend class 10 16gb)- h.264 video format- dedicated button for video instead of dial : no mistake of accidentally taking a video when wanting a picture and vice-versa- I like how the controls are laid out: I like more physical buttons rather than menu or touch screen controls- reviewing pictures on SD card is very fast- lcd picture quality is superior to canons I looked at, shows more details- manual controls work as expected- very pleased with the battery life.  Lasted multiple days without a charge- I am a fan of special batteries tailored just for the camera rather than standard AAs: they always seems to work better- stereo audio recording in videomediocre:- menu system is not always intuitive to me- auto focus for photos is descent, but sometimes not quick enough and miss some shots- focus on video is mediocre to poor, especially when zooming- lcd swivel seems qimicky to me, the canon sx30is swivel lcd approach would work better for mebad:- slowest zoom speed is too fast: it shakes the lens, and looks terrible during video- image stabilizer is inferior to all canons & panasonics that I have used, and has a wobble effect in video mode (but at least can zoom during video unlike most canons)- flash doesn't automatically pop up when needed- manual lens cap rather than an auto lens cap- although has a view finder and is a plus it is available, it is nearly useless because of its poor resolution and colors- minimum shutter speed is 4 seconds, I like using shutter speeds measured in minutes for some shots- although stereo audio recording is a plus, background noise seems greatly amplified and makes it very hard to hear the subject (there is a setting to reduce this supposedly, but I didn't notice a difference)overall:I had my expectations high, and was a little disappointed.  I would rather have had a larger image sensor than the extra zoom to get better photos out of it.  This alone would have pushed me over to giving the camera a 5 star rating.  Overall I like the camera and will keep it.  Unfortunately, there isn't much else out there with similar/better specs that would be worth trading this one in for.

Reviews.Title: Love This Product
Reviews.Author: Gail L. Singer "Gail L Singer"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my camera. The macro setting on this camera is incredible. I still have a lot to learn and I personally believe this is the camera to do it with.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features. Very low image quality.
Reviews.Author: Shomu Banerjee
Reviews.Content: Pros:* Lots of great features.* High-speed video recording.* Great zoom lens.* Superb image stabilization. (For photos, NOT videos.)Cons:* Image quality is awful, mostly due to large amounts of ISO noise.* When you use the noise reduction mode, it just smoothes it over and loses more detail.* Lowest ISO setting is 100.* HD video ripples with image stabilization.* Image stabilization ruins video audio.* High-speed video only records in short bursts of about 8 seconds.This camera has a lot of great features-I LOVE the zoom lens (though Nikon now has a newer model with 36x zoom). It's also got a great manual mode, Aperture Priority and Shutter Priority modes, Programmed Auto mode, some good white balance settings, high-speed and high definition video, etc.However, the real deal-breaker for me was the image quality, which, as I have said, is really bad. (Read my CONS section above.)So, the camera is very good in terms of features alone, but the image quality and lack of good video options really make it worth it to skip this and get the Nikon COOLPIX P500 or an affordable EVIL (Electronic Viewfinder Interchangeable Lens or "translucent mirror") camera.I wouldn't buy it again, but it'll be okay for the average user. However, budding photographers will be extremely disappointed.UPDATE: The lens started making grinding noises, and a few dead pixels appeared on the LCD, so I sent it in to get it refurbished. The new lens does not have this issue, but they wouldn't replace the LCD. This was probably just a defect. Otherwise, the camera seems to be quite durable and has lasted a few years.

Reviews.Title: Camera freezes unexpectedly
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to recommend this camera.  It has a good feel, light, many features and is a great 'grab and go' camera when you don't want to take the DSLR to the beach.  The most common complaint you will read on Amazon, Costco and the Nikon review sites, etc., is the camera unexpectedly freezing. Mine freezes with no predictable pattern of use.  When it freezes it can be cleared, like a computer, by turning the power off and on.  Sometimes it requires the added step of removing and installing the battery when the camera won't respond to the off/on button.  Color was is another common concern as is exposure consistancy and the auto focus.  I sent my P100 in for a warranty claim and the tech person said they could not locate the problem after a week of trying.  I own several other Nikons and would not trade them for other brands.  It seems the P100 is just one of those mistakes that can plague a camera maker and it would be nice if Nikon noted this, refunded our money and reminded us that Nikon has an earned reputation for quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Packable Camera
Reviews.Author: fiddler "imbuzz"
Reviews.Content: I have had a sample of just about everything from Nikon from the 60's on save the costly D3 series and I really like this one for general use if I don't need my DSLRs.  My only disappointment is that the HS 120fps is only good for 40 seconds of playback.  For those times instead I use my Casio Exilim FH100 for its 45 minutes of playback.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P100 - A Beginner's Camera
Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: This product is certainly worth the price IF you are looking for a good beginner's camera and/or lead into an SLR or DSLR model. While this is a point and shoot, it has similar settings, controls, and options to its SLR and DSLR counterparts. A worthwhile purchase for an amateur (but intrigued) photographer.

Reviews.Title: Nikon p100 is Cool
Reviews.Author: NKC
Reviews.Content: We have been using this camera now for about 1 month.  I have played with the settings and taken a lot of pictures and some video.  The still shots are definitely great, in almost any lighting, and even at long distance.  The action shots are much better than previous point-and-shoot cameras, but still have some blur.  I use the action mode and later delete unclear and unneeded pictures on my PC.  It now takes more time to sift through all the pictures I have taken than before because of this.  I recommend the p100 to anyone who is looking to upgrade from a pocket camera.  The controls and instructions are straight forward and intuitive, the picture quality superior.

Reviews.Title: sold my P300 for this one
Reviews.Author: Lassokid
Reviews.Content: I originally had the P300. Loved the lcd screen and small size, but the limited 4.2X zoom really bothered me. With the P100's 26X zoom, I was able to shoot some nice portraits with lovely bokeh (blurry backgrounds) by utilizing the zoom. I also liked the smile timer, which automatically takes a picture when the camera detects a smile. A very nice feature, as I don't have to run back and reset the timer as usual. I don't have anything bad to say about the P100, as it gives me pretty much everything I want.

Reviews.Title: Great value for US$300
Reviews.Author: darful84
Reviews.Content: I used to have a small point-and-shoot but lately I wanted to have more control over the results... this camera has a fully manual mode, great zoom and image quality is great (in my not professional opinion)... so I guess it's a very good product for those who are trying to go a bit further in their photos but without the "hassle" of heavy cameras and interchangeable lenses

Reviews.Title: Good for the pice
Reviews.Author: Brian305
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my  friend, and he seems to love it.  I liked the LCD display. It is pretty cool what you can do with it.

Reviews.Title: My lovely cam
Reviews.Author: WEWE
Reviews.Content: this camera one of the best SLR cams easy to use high quality power zoom...Very good foucs also ...FTW NIKON...!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix P100 - A bargain
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: For all its qualities and low price, Coolpix P100 is indeed a good bargain. Just loved it as an amateur photographer.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix Camera
Reviews.Author: John J. Kapusky
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning my new camera, but really like it.  It has been very easy to learn to use.  Only annoying thing at first was the sounds it makes which I learned to shut off, but also learned that I didn't know enough about the camera to hold and wait for focus so the sounds were actually helping me learn the camera -- I didn't get the pictures I thought I was taking; so I turned the sound back on until I really learn the camera.  I purchased extra memory cards and other extras (like a camera stand and bag) that make for a nice complete package.The camera itself has easy controls.  I've taken about 70 pictures, downloaded the software to my laptop and downloaded the pix.  Everything seems to be working fine.

Reviews.Title: Fabian
Reviews.Author: Leroy
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy buying from amozon, never had a problem with shipping, nor customer service. The camera works and operates great. Also very light weight. I have no issues with the zoom, its is more thsn enough. The only issuse i have is auto focus. When you are indoors, the objects have to be supper still because you will have lots of blurry pics. I tried diffrent option an still have blurry pics...maybe its a setting? I cant figure it out? I have had a cannon before and the quality is just as good. I think i'll keep it.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix P100 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: betty scott
Reviews.Content: Great Buy, You can't beat a Nikon Camera and you can't beat the price at Amazon, Thanks Amazon for quality products at a fantastic price! Truly a 5 star rating for Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera overall, but not great at either function
Reviews.Author: MH
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when I got this camera, I didn't have any unrealistic expectations. I still like the camera I just wish it was just a bit better. One of the problems I've found is the lighting issues, it always seems like I'm re-taking pictures due to lighting. Don't get me wrong, it takes good pictures 90% of the time. The video could be a lot better, the lighting problems are really noticeable when your recording video. I was expecting better resolution out of an "HD" video recorder. Overall good camera that will serve you well if you have to carry light, but will not replace a good camera and good video camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, totally satisfied!
Reviews.Author: ME2CARE4
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with my new camera, the only complaint I have is the camera case it came in, I would of prefered a better one, a bit larger, to hold all the cords and the book, as well as the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great shooter:)
Reviews.Author: jla
Reviews.Content: I didn't think I'd like a fixed lens, but this one really surprised me and I take it everywhere.  The 600+ magnification is great!:)

Reviews.Title: Great, easy to use little Nikon
Reviews.Author: roberge
Reviews.Content: What drew me to this Nikon is the electronic viewfinder. It enables you to compose your pic without the shake of the screen. Very nicely done Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy to use
Reviews.Author: August28
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix P100 about a month ago and have enjoyed it tremendously! The quality of the pictures is very clear and does a great job at taking macro pictures.I haven't really used the video yet so I can't say how well it does. From what I have seen though it does a great job.Over all its really easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P 100
Reviews.Author: Lady Birder
Reviews.Content: Had a Nikon Coolpix P 80.  Love the P 80 camera and wanted to upgrade.  Telephoto lens is amazing.  Haven't learned all the "new" bells and whistles just yet but love what I have.  Easy to carry in a waistpack and quick to use. Great for close ups and scenery and everything in between.

Reviews.Title: I really like
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Q
Reviews.Content: As a beginner on this type of camera I've had it for over a month and am still learning. I haven't had any problems that I didn't cause myself. The manual is very helpful. I read all the negative reviews on the camera before I bought it and have not experienced any yet. I had been told by an experienced photo instructor it was a good camera for the price I could afford.

Reviews.Title: great camera poor video!
Reviews.Author: charlie bit me
Reviews.Content: it has been a great camera but the video is lacking,when you shoot video you can LOUDLY HEAR! the motor running it drives us crazy, for the price they should have done better!like i said thats my only complaint,but it does shoot great pics.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Michelle R. Hill
Reviews.Content: I have the p80 and my daughter wanted a camera like it so I decided to get her the p100 for Christmas. She loves it! It has alot of cool features especially the sport mode and the zoom is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: superior quality snaps and value for money
Reviews.Author: pradnats
Reviews.Content: I purchases this camera after going through various reviews on websites. Looked at the sample pictures. I am satisfied with kind of features it offers in this range. I am not expert but I can say this camera has lot of features for people who are not expert photographers but expect more from a point and shoot. I like the 26x zoom but close-up or portrait photos are also impressive.

Reviews.Title: Nikon collpix p100
Reviews.Author: Loucob
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera, it was easy to learn most of the features.The picture quality was excellent. The only thing that disapointed me was the video/recording feature. In the paly back mode the sound is very low.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: P. Sethuramalingam "Palee"
Reviews.Content: A good camera for the price you pay. Great features for the price, but compromise on the photo quality. HD video are Pros. Worth the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: Over all, a good buy
Reviews.Author: ol' Henry
Reviews.Content: Easy to use controls, 3" LCD is great, nice single lens wide-angle to 26x zoom capability without much distortion. Quality of outdoor pictures are terrific. Only negative I have found so far is that low light pictures are not very good - indoor shots need lots of light; flash is not enough.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix 100
Reviews.Author: Gardner Bob "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera to use on vacation and was very impressed with its ease of use.  Quality you would explect in a Nikon.  Light and easy to carry.  Zoom is great and very handy to have.

Reviews.Title: Not Disapointed!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Evalt
Reviews.Content: Finally replacing my Canon T70 SLR with this Nikon P100.  This is definitely a step up!  Love it!  No regrets!

Reviews.Title: A lightweight cover for your Coolpix P100 camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the Coolpix P80 to the P100 for the HD movie mode and the faster processor - with no disappointment!GR8 megazoom 'compact SLR'.I recommend using the Nikon 9691 Coolpix Fabric Case for protecting the P100. This case is actually sold by Nikon Inc. as accessories for both the P90 and the P100 - since both cameras have similar dimensions (the P90 is 0.3 in. wider than the P100).P90 dimensions - Height: 3.3 in. Width: 4.53 in. Depth: 3.9 in.P100 dimensions - Height: 3.3 in. Width: 4.5 in. Depth: 3.9 in.The case comes without a strap. A 'clamshell' design that is great for protecting the P100 while the camera strap is around your neck or shoulder. You simply 'peel off' the velcro cover to begin  shooting ... it's that convenient to use!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P100-The Best Camera I've Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: S. Barr
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nikon Coolpix P-100 about three months ago and have worked it in every way possible.  It has performed flawlessly producing stunning results and has become the favorite camera of the four digital cameras that I own.  The only times that it has given me a 'lens error' have been the times that I forgot to remove the lens cover from the lens before turning the camera on (my fault).  By removing the lens cover, turning the camera off and then back on it has recovered perfectly every time.  Without going into great detail I'll simply say that I love this camera and it will probably be the last digital camera that I ever buy.  I believe that "Bang for the buck" this is the best camera on the market.  Truly an amazing camera!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix P100
Reviews.Author: C. C. Ford
Reviews.Content: I bought my P100 after my P90 got stolen. Identical appearance, but the P100 seems slightly better. Bigger zoom, and indoor shots are clearer. Both cameras produce excellent outdoor images.  The P100 has a neat, easy to use video capture feature which I have not played with much yet.  It's almost as good as my SLR only smaller, and you don't have to mess with lense replacement maneuvers.

Reviews.Title: RJL
Reviews.Author: J. Lyden
Reviews.Content: We heard about this high quality Camera on the Kim Komando Radio show Kim rated this Camera one of the top cameras at a recent electronic show she attended.After using my new Nikon Coolpic P100 with 26X Optical Zoom - Wide - Full HD for two weeks and seeing the pictures and videos in the bright clear colors - this has to be the best Camera I ever purchased and I am very pleased with Video Zoom Feature that operates even after the video starts.The Canon picture and Movie Camera I previously used did not allow the zoom feature after the movie started.Also, the automatic focus results in pictures that are exceptional, and not blurred.The Nikon P100 also comes with an interchangeable wire and plug that can be used to charge the battery and to transfer the pictures and videos to your computer.Great product.RJL

Reviews.Title: CoolPix P100
Reviews.Author: James Etheridge "pan&tilt;"
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera.  SLR "type" features but much lighter in weight and portability than my Nikon DSLR.  No interchangeable lenses BUT the 26x Optical zoom makes it a great alternative for an easy carry, vacation camera.  I put an 8GB card in for main use and have acquired 2 back up batteries plus an after market 12/120v charger which can charge batteries without using the camera body as a host.  Haven't shot but a little bit with it so far but really love the moveable display and having a viewfinder, esp.  for day exteriors.

Reviews.Title: I am not happy with this Camera at all.....
Reviews.Author: Meghan O'Connor
Reviews.Content: I tried for about 6 months to get used to this camera and to find the best setting to get clear pictures of by twin boys.  No such luck - I found that most all my pictures came out blurry.  It did not matter if we were inside (which I could never get a clear picture) or outside (which the photos did come out clearer but not perfect) - I do have to say that one time this past winter I took a picture of my boys and the neighborhood kids on a snow hill from my front yard - they were at my neighbor's house - I zoomed in from where I was - the picture did come out perfect - the only one from all the 100s that I took that I was very happy with. Unfortunately I am unable at this point to return this camera. I have already purchased a replacement - a Canon Rebel which I am lovin' after only a couple day of using it!

Reviews.Title: Poor excuse for a camera
Reviews.Author: G. Michael Sponsler "gms238"
Reviews.Content: To start, I've been a Nikon user since the film days.  FM, FE, 2 F3s, and have loved their high-end equipment.  I based my purchase of the P100 on that fact.  Sadly, I've been greatly disappointed in quality of the P100.To start, the picture quality is horrible; soft, lack of details, metering is totally off...I could go on and on.  The ONLY way to get an acceptable print is to Photoshop the tar out of the picture after it's taken.  Second, the build quality of this camera is very, very poor.  I understand it's considered a mega-zoom, but should the lens flop and wiggle around when it's zoomed out to any length?  Plus, after only 4 months of use the flash selection switch won't function making the possibility of a flash picture out of the question for me.Under no circumstances would I suggest this camera.  I wasted $400 on it hoping I'd get a higher quality than the standard point-and-shoot camera on the market.  Sadly, most p&s; cameras will out perform the P100.  What is worse is that I will be purchasing a DSLR this year and due to my experience with this Nikon I probably won't be purchasing the D3 or D300 I was looking at.

Reviews.Title: perfect!
Reviews.Author: W. Nguyen "win"
Reviews.Content: I am turning 15 so i asked my parents to get me this camera! By the way i'm a guy if you wondering. This is not my first camera but this is my first legit one. If you are a teen or dont have a lot of experience using a camera, this is great for you. this camera is great to show off to your friends! And i read many other reviews to this and i havent had any problems with it yet. This camera is nice and compacted. The zoom on this thing is perfect! THE PRICE FOR THIS WAS SO CHEAP FOR THE FEATURES IT OFFERS! :} im happy

Reviews.Title: Great Looking Camera, Just Wasn't For Me...
Reviews.Author: C Sinsay
Reviews.Content: The Nikon P100 is visibly appealing.  The Nikon P100 is really a great looking camera. Even the technical details such as the CMOS sensor, 1080p HD video, and the 26x optical zoom sounded like it was the perfect camera for me.  I really was excited about the camera and I couldn't wait to get shooting.  However, after a few weeks of heavy use and testing, I decided it was not the camera for me. The camera's image quality just did not satisfy me.  Under various conditions and settings, I could not obtain a picture that made me happy. The pictures taken with the P100 were often washed out, a tad blurry, and the chromatic aberrations often seemed unavoidable. The HD video was nothing to be excited about either.  The camera could not autofocus fast enough while using the zoom.  The recorded video  annoyingly picked up the noise from the cameras mechanical zoom, often drowning out the audio you did want to hear.  I really wanted to like this camera but that didn't happen.  I returned the P100 and purchased the Panasonic FZ40.  I have not regretted my decision! Happy shooting everyone!

Reviews.Title: Nikon P100 Review
Reviews.Author: Aditya
Reviews.Content: Awesome Camera. A bit complex features however photo quality makes you forget all negatives. A bit scope for improvement in MACRO mode.Otherwise I loved it.

Reviews.Title: Fine camera
Reviews.Author: J. Arce Araya
Reviews.Content: After a month I have discovered the multiple settings this camera has, sometimes I get out of focus pics but most of pics taken are fine, the more time you spend playing with the camera the better pics you can take.

Reviews.Title: brilliant camera
Reviews.Author: Mohammed Abu Wishah "moe-tallica"
Reviews.Content: the camera is amazing, and the features it holds are great compare to it's affordable priceworth the money and i recommend it

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix p100
Reviews.Author: Andrea Chandonnet
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 14 year old son and he absolutley loves it.

Reviews.Title: A Little Disappointed
Reviews.Author: William Roark
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item after 6 months of consideration.  I considered competitive cameras from Panasonic, Fuji, and Cannon.  The P100 seemed to be the best compromise in performance for the price  When you consider all the factors, it matched or exceeded the others in performance with its mega zoom, HD video, EVF, and feature rich controls.  On paper there seemed to be no contest and with the price from Amazon the best available, I made this decision.  I had been using the Panasonic point and shoot with 10X zoom and had been very happy with it, but was looking for better performance and a longer zoom.  Here are some observations from someone that is not a professional and only takes pictures on a limited basis.PROS:  The zoom is fantastic since it will get out as far as anyone really needs for normal pictures.  It was pretty easy to use right out of the box and with the choice of using the display or the electronic viewfinder, selecting pictures & framing was great.  It seems to have a good combination of automatic point and shoot qualities with the ability to manually override any setting.  Downloading pictures was a snap using the included cable, but I found the class 6 card was not readable by my computer if I removed it and put it in the slot built into the computer.  I guess the technology was not there a few years ago when my computer was new.  I really like the Look and Feel of the camera and the ability to start HD video with only one button to push.  It allows you to take pictures, then video, then back to pictures without taking the camera down from your eye.  I saw a review that mentioned a negative because you had to use the camera to charge the battery, it's true, but for less than $20 you can get 2 extra batteries and a charger from Amazon, that works great.  Overall I'm very happy with the camera.CONS:  Picture quality so far is only good.  I was expecting great.  Maybe some of this is my fault since I haven't spent as much time learning all that it can do (not enough time).  Some pictures appear "washed out" and it seems to have trouble with lighting.  Again some of this may be my inexperience with the set up of the camera.  The zoom in low light conditions is impossible to use without blurring the picture.  If you plan on using the 26X zoom, plan on buying a tripod or what I did was purchase a monopod that works great.  Again it was available from Amazon for about $20, and even works as a walking stick.  Remember to turn off the "anti-shake" feature if you use the tripod.  The last negative is minor, but annoying.  I'm still trying to figure out how to find a simple way to determine how much battery power I have left, since it appears that you only get a "warning" when the battery is out of power.  If you only have one battery, you are now waiting hours for the battery to be charged.All in all I really like the camera and still feel it is the best available for the money.  I've not used the other cameras that I considered, but I'm still confident it was the right decision.Bill

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Seco
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use, but you need to read first the manual to get excelent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Willie F.
Reviews.Content: I didn't get the benefit of a price deduction when the price dropped ten dollars before the camera shipped. so what do you want credit for? P.S. ( The  camera is great!!

Reviews.Title: It must have been a defective unit.
Reviews.Author: Ann Herrington
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my old Olympus Camedia C-5060, whose battery wouldn't hold a charge any longer. Nikon has a sterling reputation, and this camera has a long zoom, video, a viewfinder (which I thought was essential), and other attributes that I wanted. It also has the really neat tilting screen.I didn't get the quality images I expected from the very beginning. The color was bad, the focus wasn't sharp, the really long zooms required a tripod, the sound was terrible, and the videos were shaky  (don't even try to zoom in or out during a video). Occasionally the image on the screen wouldn't focus at all--it was just a massive blur. I assumed it was user error, and tried and tried and tried to correct. In fact, I tried for nearly two months, which was a mistake. Finally I showed it to a real photographer, who said "Send it back!"Because I had kept it over 30 days, Amazon would refund only 80% of my purchase price, so it cost me rather a lot of money, but I'm glad I'm rid of it. I've replaced it with an Olympus SP-800UZ, which makes beautiful images, even at 30X zoom with no tripod.I know that Nikon generally makes high-quality cameras, so my only conclusion is that this was a defective unit.

Reviews.Title: Cheap junk
Reviews.Author: TaserTot
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about half an hour before returning it. I took a few pics and some video. The picture quality is terrible. Every shot was either under or over exposed, or not focused. After about 10 photos the lens froze while zoomed out. It is on it's way back to Amazon. I don't know what to do now. I thought this was "the one". I'm looking at a Finepix HS10 but I'm not sure about that one either. It seems the cameras in this category with the best reviews are way over priced. Back to the 'ole drawing board.

Reviews.Title: Washed out pictures, impossible to control vibration at large zoom
Reviews.Author: John Galt
Reviews.Content: Had to return this item after playing with it for a while. Immediately noticed that the pictures are washed out, much lower quality than my Canon. The picture appears better temporarily while focusing but then loses color. Plus, I really struggled with taking pics with high zoom. Almost all my pics had unacceptably high vibration even when I used it sitting down on objects within the room.

Reviews.Title: After owning it for 1 month..
Reviews.Author: Cathey S
Reviews.Content: I purchased it at costco, they had it for pretty cheap about a month ago ($370-). After taking it to Atlanta, Zoo, Carshows, (and in all types of hot, muggy weather I have to add) it's not a bad camera for quick shots with significantly good color. Pictures taken by the p100 weren't meant to be taken with the zoom in all the way, it kills the quality and clarity of the picture.But I'm dissapointed with this camera. After less than a month of using it (it was brand new when I purchased it) the zoom had froze on me. The cam also gave me an error which you normally get when the lens cap is still on when you turn on the camera without removing it first, after I had already taken it off. The cam has always been neatly and safely tucked away in its case provided with my purchase... yet I have these issues. Last but not least, right before I decided to return the camera, it began having static type lines, like ones you'd see on your tv when a storm is coming. Indeed it is a great camera, but the errors and issues with it don't make it the most reliable camera :(

Reviews.Title: Improved version of the P90. Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel "RE"
Reviews.Content: This bridge camera works pretty well in almost every condition that you need to take a picture... Face pictures, scenery, dawn, dusk, even sports or slow motions vids...This camera has given me very good results in terms of photo quality, control of its functions and shoot speed (especially when you need a quick photo.) If I have to say something bad about this camera .... Video recording is not its strongest point though the video quality works very well, but if you want good pictures, excellent zoom with a stabilizer that works very well, wide angle ... This camera is for you. It have a good price too...P.S. my english is bad... sorry ;)

Reviews.Title: Alternate for my SLR
Reviews.Author: KatCat
Reviews.Content: Lightweight but versitle, can't wait to take on a trip soon to try it out. Reviewed many "like" cameras and had purchased Olympus 590 for daughter, freind has Canon equivilant, hope this is even beter. Mostly tired of carrying all the weight of the SLR and lenses on trips so decided to give this a try and still have telephoto capability, so far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable
Reviews.Author: Frank A. Pfeifenroth
Reviews.Content: First off, Amazon amazed me by shipping the product over a week before the product release by Nikon.  I couldn't believe it.  The camera is terrific with more outstanding features than I can adequately cover here.  I'm still learning but the early returns are excellent. It is so easy to use with some really powerful features.  The 26x optical zoom and macro ability are extraordinary.  The 1080p video is unmatched in the industry. As far as I know, no one else offers 1080p.  Linking the camera to a Hi-def television via HDMI cable is so convenient.  I haven't discovered a con yet unless it is the learning curve, especially if you are a beginner.  But even that is minimal - just do what you can do and learn the rest as you go.  The sensor and electronics are exceptional.  So far, can't say enough good things.  And the early delivery was the icing on the cake.  Well done!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon cool Pix 100
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I have experminted with this camera quite a bit and so far i am quite pleased with the quality and most of the features,for it's size it is a great back up camera

Reviews.Title: My best so far.
Reviews.Author: Louis Tremblay
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great camera for the money...very well rated by my known non-profit agency... the zoom is super.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: Chance in CT
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my husband for Christmas and he loved it! I was torn between this and a Canon, since our previous camera was a Canon. However, I'm very happy with this purchase, and so is the hubby.It's very easy to use, and all the features are great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alec
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing, simple to use for starters and just over great features for the more experienced.  The zoom on this has came in handy to make some really amazing wildlife pics and videos are just a huge bonus added in.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey R. Babb "happy camper"
Reviews.Content: Delivered even earlier than expected!!! So happy with the service and excited about the camera!!!!!

Reviews.Title: one
Reviews.Author: Charles G. Detwiler, Jr. "reader Charles"
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera as a whole: focusing system, picture definition, ergonomics, menue system, flash system,quality of pictures, telescopic system. i rate the camera as excellent.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P100
Reviews.Author: Photo Novice
Reviews.Content: Really easy to use-point and shoot. There are lots of options if you choose to explore-I will get them eventually.  I love the zoom. No complaints so far.

Reviews.Title: higher than my expectations!!!
Reviews.Author: mafesampaio
Reviews.Content: This camera is over my expectations!Is lighter than I tought it would be, the battery life is long and the pictures quality is really good.About the price, I can say that is totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon p100
Reviews.Author: Olens Mom
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix P100 10 MP Digital Camera with 26x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Excellent - Full Featured Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Aurigemma
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  My family has been looking for a camera better then a typical point and shoot and not as bulky/expensive as a DSLR.  What we found was the Coolpix P100.  The camera has a set of amazing features and an excellent zoom.  I used the camera at a graduation as well as at some sporting events and the modes work well.  The sport shooting captured clear pictures of people in motion which is one of our favorite features along with the zoon.Definitely would recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: nikon p100
Reviews.Author: Gunay Arslan "gunay"
Reviews.Content: I am still in search for a very fast and sharp camera. Nikon p100 is light and takes ok pictures but still not covering up my expectations. It is good with still pictures. But while on move or spontaneous photos they come out blurry. has many functions but makes you lose time while setting the right mode. ý have a tiny casio and ý am sad to write that it is x3 faster and almost the same picture quality. battery goes only for a day if you use is wisely. so ý d suggest to carry extra battery.

Reviews.Title: The Camera That Shouldn't Have Nikon's Name On It
Reviews.Author: David S. McMeans
Reviews.Content: Given my satisfaction with Nikon's DSLR cameras (d70,d40,d5000), I had high hopes that this would be a reasonably decent point-and-shoot.It was not. It was so disappointing, I'm not sure why Nikon made it. If I were Nikon, and this were the best I could make in the category, I'd stop production for that category altogether as it would be too damaging to my brand.The image quality was "washed out." The vivid setting looked the same as the normal setting. It was so frustrating to watch the image look good, actually pretty good in the LCD view finder just before the camera took it, and then see the resulting image look washed out and lifeless. The video actually looked a bit more vibrant than stills.It had difficultly focusing at certain zoom settings. I would have to zoom out or in to get it to focus.The video, when played back on the computer, would stutter or show signs of pixelation for some clips. Other clips were fine.The smile detection mode worked very well. We had lots of fun playing "Don't Smile!" with it. Unfortunately, that wasn't why I bought it.The LCD articulates up and down, which is great for taking shots close to the ground.I bought this because the Canon we had died after prolonged periods of not using it (common issue with Canon shutters). I thought I would avoid this problem by going with a Nikon point and shoot. In the end I returned the Nikon P100 and got a comparable Canon.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't meet expectations...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rodin"
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera a month ago to take on a vacation, good thing tested it before going on the vacation. The unit had a dead pixel in the sensor which showed up as a blue spot on all the pictures I took.Buying a Nikon prosumer bridge camera my expectations were set very high based on the reviews I had read, however those expectations were not met even half way. To spend $400.00 for the top of the line point and shoot Nikon model and get middling results was to say the least disappointing part of the entire experience. Picture quality was half way decent, this based on my experience of using my prior 2 year old Kodak 8612 for comparison. I guess picture taking really has to do more with subject matter, composition, and experience than just having technology at your fingertips, this was so true when using the Nikon P100 and trying to take shots on the fly!The Nikon P100 is an unusually small and compact size camera  for the features it boasts. The swivel LCD screen is a nice gimmick, but falls short of any usefulness because it swivels only partially up or down, unlike the full swiveling screens in the Canon SX..IS models, which allows you to compose self portraits. There is no option to use a secondary flash on this unit or any option to use any kind of filters, which defeats the purpose of having manual control over-rides. The 26x zoom is a nice touch, but better have very steady hands to use it otherwise you need to control your voyeuristic tendencies. The 1080p video recording option is also overkill as it fills up the memory card really fast and before you realize it you have run out of memory to take more pictures or you end up deleting the video you just took to take some more pictures, neither which is a great option when on a vacation you are trying to digitize every moment for posterity.Till now I had never been a big fan of high end expensive point and shoot cameras, and my experience with the Nikon P100 has reinforced my belief that if you are going to use a point and shoot there is no need to splurge and waste your money on something like it. If your are really serious about bringing the creativity out in yourself then bite the bullet and go for a mid-price DSLR which will give you the most options as and when you progress in your abilities.

Reviews.Title: Camera freezes
Reviews.Author: Auramagna
Reviews.Content: I read reviews that stated it froze at times. On the first day it was purchased, it froze twice, requiring the reinsertion of the battery. Hot stuff when your taking important pix! Focus was inaccurate in lower light settings. I returned it the next day. The Sony HX-1 puts the Nikon P100 to shame.

Reviews.Title: It's okay but not great
Reviews.Author: L. Bedford
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and has a very long zoom. It's light to carry and offers some additional bells and whistles if you like to experiment with more advanced features. However, the focusing is very slow and at maximum zoom, blur is all but inevitable. The flash is weak. Macro seems to work okay. If you are doing everyday photography, this is an okay camera. But if you photographing fast moving toddlers or pets, you are going to get frustrated very quickly. Not a bad camera but there are better ones out there.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: JoK
Reviews.Content: Getting some great pictures with this camera.  The vibration reduction works really well.  I have even gotten some good pics of the full moon without a tripod, however I had to use the manual settings mode.  The only drawback I have is the lens movement when not in use, like the lens is loose.  But I did investigate this and they all do it, apparently, so it's just something I will get used to.You will love this camera.  The 26X zoom is getting me some great pictures of wildlife and surfers that are way out in the surf.  I am normally a Canon person, but I am really glad I decided to get this Nikon instead.  It's smaller and lighter than all the other cameras I tried in the store too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, greater zoom!
Reviews.Author: Joyce L. Scuderi
Reviews.Content: I waited for months for this camera and it is worth it.  The zoom lens is great when it comes to the shots I take

Reviews.Title: Sorry but couldn't keep it...
Reviews.Author: J. P. Riquezes
Reviews.Content: Many things went OK but 2 were enough to led me to let it go...1) Got the camara with expectation... I turned it ON... first message on the screen... "ERROR"... WHAT???!!! Then I realized that I was forced to take off the cap to continue, even if we just wanted to review photos taken. It makes no sense! UNACCEPTABLE for a camera of that range of price and that is supposedly high tech.2) The battery charger included works connecting the camera with the battery inside. This forces you to leave the camera aside, being unable to take photos with another battery while charging. Very inconvenient.I bought the Lumix FZ40 and I'm so happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Worst focus of any camera I ever owned
Reviews.Author: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: The pictures are never very clear or sharp except in a very few / limited situations.  And if you move the zoom more than a couple of times the focus goes quite blurry and never recovers.  Some previous reviews by others suggested that removing the batteries lets the camera recover.  Not true.  As soon as you turn it back on and move the zoom a few more times it loses what little focus it did have.  I get pictures that are far clearer than the p100 by shooting the same shot with a cheap Sony compact camera with 1/3 the pixels.  Oh - almost forgot to mention, the service folks are no help on this either.  Everything else about the camera is ok, but are just average for this class of camera - i.e. it's functionality is nothing special.  I really wish I could return this camera and get my money back.

Reviews.Title: Poor photo quality, slow performance
Reviews.Author: S. Poe
Reviews.Content: Below are the reasons I returned the P100. I used the camera for a weekend at a soccer tournament, outdoor evening party, and a birthday party indoors.1) the view finder is worthless; it is like looking through a 1950's TV. It cannot be used to track a running child on a soccer field. The quality of the image you see when looking through the viewfinder is also very, very poor.2) the sport mode captures great sequences, BUT you have to wait 15-20 seconds (or longer) for the sequence to record BEFORE you can focus and shoot your next photo. For me, it was a huge deal breaker.3) the flash is powerful, BUT it distorts colors. I found this to be true when shooting outside and indoors.4) the image sensor cannot operate in sun/shade conditions. I was shooting a soccer game in the shade, but the field was in full sun. The only way I could get the sensor to adapt to the full sun was to point the lens towards the sky and then back down to the players on the field. Can you imagine having to do this for every photo?

Reviews.Title: Absolutely awesome preformance at a bargain price
Reviews.Author: Thomas Seiler
Reviews.Content: After several months of putting this bad boy through it's paces I am completely satisfied. I have taken a hand held shot of the moon and gotten stunning results. The lens, even at it's longest zoom produces very nice images. The HD movies must seen to be believed. Use the HDMI output to show your movies on an HDTV and you will think you are watching a DVD. Where the P100 really shines is in Macro mode. The Macro mode is made even more user friendly by the flip up and flip down LCD screen. This is the first one I have used and I will never be without this feature again.There are so many different modes and options I still haven't explored them all. My favorite option is BSS mode. That stands for Best Shot Selector. In this mode you can shoot a stationary subject (doesn't work on moving subjects) and hold down the shutter button as it takes up to ten shots at about 2 frames per second. Then when you are done shooting it will choose the sharpest shot of the group and save it and delete the rest. True magic.The menu systems are clear and easy to find things with. One of the things that really impress me over other "bridge" cameras I have owned is the ability to remember your settings when you turn the camera off. Every other camera I have had reverts to the default setting when you turn the camera back on, which can be a real pain.The only real negative I can come up with for this camera is I have not been too successful at birds in flight. I seriously considered the Canon SX20IS, the Olympus 800 and the Fuji HS10 before I decided on the P100 and I am glad I made the right decision for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, buy battery level indicator sucks
Reviews.Author: AMR
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a long time to replace my aging digital camera, and the Nikon Coolpix P100 fit the bill perfectly. My only complaint so far is the rather stupid battery level indicator: when it comes on you're almost out of battery! No early warning, no way of checking your actual battery level at any time. My older camera included a battery meter icon that was divided in several bars, so you could actually estimate pretty well the remaining battery charge at any time by just counting the number of bars shown on the battery icon. Not so with the P100: as per page 26 of the manual if the battery icon is OFF your battery is still OK (it actually states "Battery Fully Charged"). Once the icon appears it means "Battery level LOW, prepare to charge or replace the battery". So this basically allows a situation in which the battery level might be slightly above the warning threshold, so you might actually think you are still good to go, when in reality you're almost out of battery. I presume the Lithium battery used in this camera is of the "intelligent" kind, so implementing a better battery charge meter should have been very easy in terms of the ability to accurately read the battery status. My 8+ year old Sony camera does that.This is my first Nikon camera, so unless this type indicator style has been the norm, frankly I can't understand why Nikon would implement such a useless battery level indicator. Granted I would never leave without a spare battery, and from experience with my earlier camera, your battery charge will invariably always be exhausted when it is needed the most, so I always had a second battery on hand. But this is beyond the point of this discussion.My opinion of the very least battery charge meter resolution I could live with in this camera:No battery icon shown: Battery between 100-50% charged.Battery icon shown steady: Battery charge between 50-10%.Battery icon flashing: less then 10% charge remaining.So Nikon, the Coolpix P100 is undoubtedly a great camera, but perhaps you could fix the flimsy battery level indicator with a Firmware download/upgrade and that can be performed from the end user side. Mine has v1.0 so I hope something will be done to correct this mistake. This model being brand new, hopefully as more people buy it and also realize this small but significant shortcoming, more complaints will be heard and hopefully something will be done about it. If anybody else agrees with me, please also write a review about it. And if the Firmware upgrade becomes available, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: LCD didn't work and shipping was late
Reviews.Author: Mark J. Bradeen
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience purchasing my Nikon Coolpix P100. I paid extra $26 for the two day delivery so I would have camera for my kids first day of school. Amazon failed me. They took three days for delivery, so I had to take photos with my blackberry. When I did received the camera today the LCD monitor only displays a bright white screen. The view finder works fine, but when you switch back to LCD mode it shows the white screen again. Poor quality from Nikon and poor service from Amazon. I'm returning the camera. Update 9-4-10, Amazon said they would send me a new camera with one day shipping on Wednesday night, so I would have it on Friday. Now today, Saturday, the estimated deliver date is Tuesday, 9/7/10. The obviously didn't really pay for overnight delivery like they said they did, so now I have my blackberry for my Labor Day weekend pictures.

Reviews.Title: Will never buy Nikon again
Reviews.Author: JNau
Reviews.Content: I have always been a Canon girl but heard such good things about Nikon I thought I would give it a try.  I used to have a Canon Powershot, which I was very happy with, but kept upgrading until I got a professional-grade camera (Mark ii).  I needed an inexpensive "daily" camera to keep in my purse and thought this looked like a good camera, especially after reading all of the reviews.  I used this Nikon at a concert and was about ready to chuck it across the building.  It would freeze up and get confused when trying to focus on the performers.  I had to shut it down and turn it on again.  If you have the lens cover on it will give you an error and you have to turn it on and off again.  This is not necessary - if you can't see anything in the viewfinder the lens cap is obviously on!  At one point it took an entire series of shots even though I only pushed the button once.  At one point there was some kind of digital line appearing in a bunch of my pictures.  If you are looking for a good quailty point and shoot camera, don't waste your money - get a Canon Powershot!!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Heymama
Reviews.Content: My son was so excited to receive this camera for his birthday. Only problem, I now need to get one for my husband.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: REM Ramos
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to receiving this camera. We waited a while before it went down below $300. Mainly got it for video purposes (1080p) and the long zoom capabilities.When you zoom in or out, the camera makes a lot of noise. And there is a constant sound that the lens makes when you are using the video because of the AUTO-FOCUS feature. If you are using the video in a quiet setting, say your kid's recital, you will definitely hear the lens in the background. It is quite noticeable and is almost a deal breaker. You're almost better off getting a decently priced HD video camera and another point and shoot camera. We opted to go for this combo but we are not happy with the audio mainly because of the focusing background noise.

Reviews.Title: Hope Nikon can fix it
Reviews.Author: 13nvnt
Reviews.Content: Camera worked well for about  two weeks . Then the funtion selector on back of the camera stoped working . Would not set the self timer or select other funtions activated by that button.Camera needs to be sent to Nikon for repair or replacement.

Reviews.Title: Photo Quality
Reviews.Author: sm
Reviews.Content: the quality of the photos was very average. Zoom lens was good but there was too much shake and distortion with it. Indoor results were average.Returned the camera. Need to spend more and buy better technology.

Reviews.Title: Please don't buy this Camera if you think it will deliver SLR like quality
Reviews.Author: Runal Kulkarni
Reviews.Content: As I said if you are moving from a compact camera to something heavy like P100 expecting that it will deliver SLR like image quality you will be disappointed. I bought this camera thinking that it will deliver better quality close to SLR but I ws wrong. So returned this camera and bought Nikon D3100 which is not that bulky but delivers great image quality.

Reviews.Title: decent camera
Reviews.Author: sawyer
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera.  I haven't actually loaded the s/w or printed pics or taken video, but at first glance and just by taking some pics, I notice the following:1) Not crazy about the fact you have to remove the lens cap.  It's a pain, but then again I always had to with my SLR, but at least then I could turn the thing on.  Right now you can feel the lens want to come out and you get an error message.  2) Not sure about the fact that I have to press a button to get the flash to work.  I wish it was automatic.Seems like it has a lot of cool functions.  I'll post again when I actually print some pics.

Reviews.Title: Imagery Analysist
Reviews.Author: DKN
Reviews.Content: After using digital camera's since they have been introduced I have several major issues with this camera:- Pressing the Movie Button temporarly locks up the camera at a critical time when your attempting to capture a moving object-In the "Sport Mode" the camera captures 25 frames and again locks up in the process and you can not view continued sports action during this time- The zoom lens control is very eratic in operation and not smooth, just touch it momentarly and it zooms radically thus also causing you to loose sight of the object that your following.After 3 week I gave the camera away

Reviews.Title: P 100 great
Reviews.Author: Steve Ballard
Reviews.Content: Every thing works as should! easy to use! good price! shipping great! right out of the box use!acessories easy to be had! Thanks Amazon...

Reviews.Title: Nikon P100 coolpix
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: The usual Nikon quality and dependability with great features and results.I would prefer a manual zoom for more precise zooming. Also lacks accessory clip for aux flash.Overall the camera is very high quality with excellent results.Best price and speedy delivery with Amazon

Reviews.Title: MEJOR OPCION
Reviews.Author: Nicolas
